Reviews.Title: Fantastic Image Display
Reviews.Author: tbone
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV was stunning right out of the box. After a few minor adjustments it was as close to perfect as I could imagine. It came with the SQ01 panel and it would be hard to differentiate the color depth and quality from some of the plasma sets I looked at. The TV is in a very bright room and the matte screen cuts out glare with no picture degradation. The viewing angle is very good, though we are never more than 25 to 30 degrees off center. The picture is very stable from channel to channel with no change in the back lighting that I can see, and the standard definition picture is almost HD quality when using the 16:9 picture format. It has separate settings for processing speed and anti-judder for motion blur when using the Custom view mode, unlike the majority of sets that combine both settings into one. I watch a lot of sports and really don't notice motion blur at 60hz so its certainly not an issue at 120hz. I'm not a gamer, so for my viewing habits I see no need to spend more for a 240hz option. The sound is very good for normal TV viewing. It can be connected to a home network and I have also hooked it up to my laptop using the VGA connection to watch Netflix and even that produces an acceptable SD picture. There are multiple picture settings you can use to suit just about any programming source, including watching at 120hz without the "soap opera" effect that some people find so annoying. There are 4 HDMI and 2 USB connections, plus one for headphones. There is no S video so you may need cables to hook up older external equipment. UVerse is the programming source.One thing about settings. The first evening the picture suddenly got much darker and even though I would reset the brightness, it would get dark again once I left the menu. I spoke with Samsung and they had no idea why this was happening. It turns out this set automatically adjusts the picture to your room brightness in the Standard viewing mode, which is the factory default. You can change this in the Eco portion of the picture menu to never go below a certain brightness level or you can turn it off completely. This is not an issue when using any other viewing mode.The last time I bought a LCD I continued to look around in case I found something better. That will not be the case this time as I am completely satisfied. Pilot shipping through Amazon was great. They delivered on time, set up the TV and swivel stand, and had everything working in 5-10 minutes.Added note on Warranty: If you purchase an item with your Amazon Visa, or pretty much any credit card from a major bank, it extends the manufacturer's warranty 100% over the original duration (one year to two, etc.) at no cost. Amazon verified this but check with your bank if you use a non-Amazon card.

Reviews.Title: A Home Theater Centerpiece
Reviews.Author: J. Hopkins "hopjohn"
Reviews.Content: Firstly, it's important to point out that I was shopping strictly for a high quality 1080p display. I have a home theater with external speakers and an advanced learning remote so the TV's audio quality and stock remote played an insignificant role in my decision to purchase this model. Now then, the LN46C630 was the best 46" 1080p display I could find that had all the features I was looking for. My criteria were for a model with 120hz, an adequate amount of HDMI inputs (4), a pc input, largely tweakable picture controls, excellent black levels, an absence of motion blur, and a cost of under $1000. This TV possesses all of those things, and beat out the competition of similar LG and Sony models because of what I deemed to be the cleanest, most well defined image, along with superior black levels. The only thing I felt lacking on this TV was the screen texture which is more prone to glare. Though, because my room is quite dark that was of no real concern either, but could be to others with more ambient light in there viewing room.Here are a couple features I learned about only after I had the set that may be useful in making a decision.:-The TV has Eco Sensor which will automatically adjust the brightness of the TV based on the ambient light of the room. No worries, this CAN easily be turned off, and is definitely something to be aware of.-In the Advanced settings menu there are 2 expert patterns that you can use to dial in your picture settings. One is a contrast / brightness pattern, the other a color pattern.-If you'll be using the TV's speakers there is volume equalization which adjusts the volume automatically as you switch channel to channel.-You can stream media to this TV through your wired LAN or from an external USB storage device. if you want to do wireless, you'll need Samsung's optional wireless adapter.-The stock remote has a very narrow IR stream. You'll want to point it not at the center of the screen as most people do, but at the bottom right corner. It works fantastic once you learn to do that.Some other important notes I'd mention to those that purchase this model:-At default levels the contrast is maxed out to 100 for every input. I and many others refer to this as "torch mode". That setting will shorten the life of your TV immensely and it needs to be adjusted first thing for each input. While properly calibrating your TV is more than I care to get into here (and pointless since every display is different as well as every input), a setting of 50 contrast and 50 brightness is good place to start for those that don't have any other means of calibrating it more precisely. I also lowered the back light from a default 14 to 10.-Under the picture options there is a setting called Auto Motion Plus. This is what controls motion blur. Familiarize yourself with the effects of this control. If you are like me it's going be disturbing to have this control on "Standard' to view bluray movies because it removes the natural blur of the camera moving and panning which to me is an annoyance. I use the "Clear" mode or just turn it off for movies.-Also the effects of the sharpness control only add noise to your image, use the sharpness control very judiciously. I have mine all the way down to a setting of 9.All in all this is a fantastic set for the price. The very minor issues it has are far outweighed by the price, the amazing picture quality, and the tremendous control you have over adjusting the image to your liking.

Reviews.Title: It has great potential
Reviews.Author: rainmakr
Reviews.Content: I first ordered this set in early August and I really wanted to like this television.  It is easy to set up, it has a good remote, and the built-in speakers are acceptable.  At first glance, the picture is very good (once taken out of "torch mode" and the "soap opera effect" has been minimized by turning off (or minimizing) the Auto Motion Plus feature.  The backlit remote is nice, but not *all* of the buttons are lit.  I'm not sure why, and there were times when I needed the unlit ones.  And, being unfamiliar with the remote, had to turn on/up the room lights to see what I was doing.  But, the main problem I encountered with this set was the color uniformity.After having watched for a week and having some time to get past my initial awe at how good this set seemed to be, I noticed a flaw in the left side of the picture.  When panning a football field, I saw that the left 6" or so of the screen was lighter than the rest.  And when viewing scenes that had a lot of red in them, the left 6" of the screen was significantly lighter than the rest of the screen.  Note that I was sitting about 8' away, dead center -- off-axis viewing was not the issue.I tried to ignore it, but finally created some solid color slides and viewed them using the television's built-in slide-show feature.  What I found was that the left side was significantly lighter than the rest of the screen.  It wasn't very noticeable on blue slides, but was very prominent on red and green slides, though bright reds & greens were less of an issue.  I kept the TV second week, trying to get past it, but the problem was distracting when watching football.  And, when watching interviews with "America's Got Talent" judges, their skin tone and the red backdrop was frequently discolored (interviews were usually framed with the face on the left side of the screen).I asked Amazon for a replacement, which they sent without a problem and at their expense (as was the return shipping).  The replacement set I received was better.  But, again about a week after having the set, I noticed the same problem (though not as pronounced).  Again, I tried to get past it -- not only did I not want to deal with a return, but didn't want to deal with researching a replacement make and model. Just when I thought I could live with it, I noticed a 2" (approx.) vertical stripe on the left side of the screen.  The stripe was a section of panel that was brighter than the rest of the panel.  It had hard edges, indicating to me that it was a panel problem.  During most shows I didn't notice it; but, it was very prominent during a few dark scenes of Up, Star Trek, and a few others.Again, I loaded the color slides I had made, which revealed light leakage (or clouding, whatever it's called), similar to the first set.  It also revealed the stripe in quite a few of the slides.  Considering the price of this television, I called Amazon and asked to return it.  I was offered a replacement, which I considered, but ultimately decided to return it and get something else (Panasonic TC-P46G25).For those wondering, labels on both sets (and the boxes they came in) indicated an AA02 panel.Summary:-------PROS:- adequate sound quality from built-in speakers- decent remote- picture mode button on remote (Vivid, movie, etc)- Sleep button on remote- backlit remote- back of television has a kensington lock slot- non-glare screen is very good in rooms with a lot of windows & ambient lightCONS:- not all buttons on remote are backlit- default Auto Motion Plus (AMP) setting results in a horrible "soap opera" effect- color/picture uniformityNotes about the "Amazon experience":- I had no problems with the local delivery company, which was CEVA for me- Amazon paid all shipping costs, both ways- Amazon did not give me any hassle at any time

Reviews.Title: CAN YOU SAY "WOW"?
Reviews.Author: J. G. B. "Jim"
Reviews.Content: I've had this LCD HDTV for roughly 2 weeks, and all I can really say is WOW!!!For the price of a little over $900.00 and the terms of 2 years to pay it off with no interest by using the Amazon store card it was a "NO BRAINER".  I've been looking in store and on-line for over 2 years, LCD, LED, Refurbished, Consumer Reports, etc...  By reading the reports and reviews from different web-sites and from personal viewing in store the Samsung seemed (to me any-ways) to out shine the others.  The picture is just breath taking out of the box. With the different viewing modes and the 120 Hz auto-motion watching a HD Television program or especially a Blue ray video is quite amazing.  Yes... I've read in other reviews the speakers don't sound as good as my 20 year old Color Console did... but I didn't buy it for the speakers....  Yes the remote is a little difficult at first, but once it's set I use the Cable Box remote controller more than anything.  I really did get a kick out of being able to plug in my External Hard Drive into the USB Port on the back of the set, having the set automatically find the drive then display the directory of movies that I have downloaded from Netflix on it, and then with the push of a button play them.... Well I think I have a very good base to start with, next comes a external sound set up, and then an internet ready Blue ray player. I bought the Square Trade 3 year policy with it, what ever you do buy a policy with any set you are planing to buy.  With the 1 year Samsung warranty, the Amazon return policy, and the Square Trade coverage I think I have all the bases covered... For the price and the performance I don't think you can go wrong with this one... I'll add to this review later on if anything should come up.*********************************************************** 5-03-2011Well he I am 1 year after my purchase...The HDTV is still going strong... at least 4 to 5 hours a day, and I was just exclaiming too my Mrs. while watching the Royal Wedding on BBC America in HD what a breathtaking picture this set still has, I feel that the display is as good today as it was a year ago when it came out of the box.  Yep I added an external sound system to it, and a desktop computer also. It now has theater quality sound and HD video streaming when I want, and can I surf my Facebook page from my Lazy-Boy when I wish using my  wireless hand held keyboard.Just one thing to say..... I hope you will be as happy with your set as I have been with mine.And as I said before if anything should come up I will post here.

Reviews.Title: I am pleased I chose this Samsung as my first LCD tv
Reviews.Author: D. Crook
Reviews.Content: This was my first expierence with high definition television. I decided to get a Samsung after doing a lot of homework. The set has a lot of features and the picture quality is outstanding. I really like that you can control your picture settings for each input (cable box, dvd, video games). I connected a Playstaion and Wii using component cables and put the tv in game mode - wow! I also have an upconverting dvd player connected thru hdmi cable and some scenes look almost three dimensional. The matte screen is great for cutting down on glare. I am an avid sports fan now enjoying high def cable and the trumotion 120hz really helps for the fast movements on the screen. I was cautious about making such a large purchase over the internet but Amazon was great and the delivery through CEVA was decent. Delivery was within 3 working days and they helped me unbox and check that the tv worked properly. I would highly recommend this set for anyone looking for an affordable 46" LCD tv packed with great features and an awesome picture at a great price.

Reviews.Title: A Very good TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Techie "Zeeboy"
Reviews.Content: I have been using this TV for over a month now and everything is good about it so far.The only thing that I would have loved in this TV was to have the Samsung Internet@TV feature, where I could directly watch You Tube videos, Netflix etc, but this TV does not have this feature, unlike some other high-end Samsung HDTVs. That was dissapointing. I wish I had spend a couple of hundered dollars more and got a model with Internet@TV feature.But, you can still hook up this TV to your wireless router at home and stream videos and pictures from your PC/Laptop wirelessly.I am planning to buy the Samsung Blue-Ray 5.1 channel home theatre system with the Internet@TV feature, and that would take care of everything that is lacking in this TV that I would like to have.If you are not looking for advanced features, but a very good reliable TV with great picture quality, this is a very good buy for the money.

Reviews.Title: LED vs LCD and a Note for Gamers.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Gamers, see the bottom of this review!We have been shopping for a TV for a while and at first we were going to go with the Vizio LCD that is 47" and 120hz, but the picture quality on the Samsung was just too good. The Vizio looked washed out and sad compared to it, so we decided to go with the Samsung 46" LCD. We ended up with the wrong TV (not through Amazon). We were given the LED version and decided that we would just keep it, even though it cost more.Well, we ended up returning the LED and getting the original Samsung LCD that we wanted. In our opinion the LED is not worth the extra money. The only thing I liked better was that the TV itself was a slim design, but the difference was negligible.We went to Wal-Mart and Best Buy before deciding to return the TV and carefully studied the differences between the Samsung LED and the Saumsung LCD and I understand that there is a lot of personal preference involved here, I preferred the picture on the LCD. As soon as I got the LCD home I knew we had made the right choice. Some people prefer the LED; to me it was actually too bright and I didn't notice a substantial change in quality. If any change, to be honest. The only difference I noticed was in the brightness.If you are the type of person who needs to have the latest and greatest thing, the LED will probably be what you want, but if you want a good TV that looks nice and will probably save you a few dollars, go with the LCD. And I would recommend avoiding trying to save money by going with the 60hz LED over the 120hz LCD. The only time I would recommend a 60hz is for straight gaming. See below.To my fellow gamers out there! I hooked my Xbox360 via HDMI cable to this TV as soon as I got it unpacked and the quality is amazing. I played several games to test it out for about two hours and never noticed any any problems and I was really looking for one. If I had had even the slightest hick-up I would be writing about it.If you are going to be using your TV for gaming only, go ahead and save some money by getting the 60hz, either LED or LCD. 60hz is ideal for gaming and, in fact, when you put your TV in "gaming" mode it's just going down from 120hz to 60hz. This TV, from what I have noticed, actually somehow puts itself in gaming mode when you turn on the Xbox. I have noticed that everytime I switch it to Xbox the screen says something about switching to 60hz.If you are going to be watching TV or DVDs and playing games, I would strongly suggest that you invest in a 120hz, but if you will only be gaming 60 is great.

Reviews.Title: What a awesome TV especially for the price
Reviews.Author: eric "eric"
Reviews.Content: I picked this TV up this weekend and all I can say is WOW.  Set up was easy.  A little note to those who think they received the wrong stand, the stand slides into a slot on the bottom of the TV.  It took my girlfriend pointing this out while I kept trying to rest the TV on the stand and making the holes line up.  The first thing we did was put in a BD movie and the contrast and clarity was everything you could want in a HD TV (outside of a LED).  The room it is set up in is kind of bright but the picture quality was barely affected.  Once the room was dark everything was ultra vivid.  Highly recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: At last: An Update To Help with the Volume Issue
Reviews.Author: M. Robinson
Reviews.Content: [This is an update to my original review: As of 9-1-2010 there is an update on Samsung's website that helps with the volume going up and down which was very annoying.] I kept waiting for the price of last year's model to go down but I didn't have much luck with that.  In the mean time I starting reading that the Samsung 2010 models were about to hit the market.  When I saw that the price was lower than last year's model, I decided to buy.  I haven't been disappointed since then.I read many great reviews about last year's model (LN46B630) which helped in my decision.  That, combined with a lower price, a better contrast ratio  (120000:1 vs. 80000:1), and the 2010's picture displaying 100% of the NTSC Color Standard, helped to seal the deal. My only regret is that the remote control was/is difficult for me to learn.I received my new tv 10 days after I placed my order, which was not bad considering I got free shipping. Also, the delivery men bought the tv into my living room, took it out of the box, put the stand on for me, and placed the tv where I wanted it.I knew I had an excellent tv when I watched "The Ten Commandments" on broadcast tv.  I saw colors that I had NEVER seen before in this film, and I've seen this movie many times.Great job Amazon and Samsung!  Happy Viewing.

Reviews.Title: Great - Once you set it up & turn off the Auto Motion Plus feature
Reviews.Author: D. Murphy
Reviews.Content: While watching The Pacific on HBO High-Def over DirecTV, I found the picture to be very choppy. Once I turned off "Auto Motion Plus 120Hz" and just set it to 60Hz, the picture was much smoother.Here are my picture settings, which I am very happy with (I have a very dark room):Mode: NaturalBacklit: 15Contrast: 75Brightness: 50Sharpness: 33Color: 60Tint: G50/R50Picture Options ->Colortone: NormalDigital Noise Filter: OffMPEG Noise Filter: OffHope this helps you!

Reviews.Title: Great TV.
Reviews.Author: P. Rosenzweig
Reviews.Content: Purchased this a couple of weeks back and was a little bit frustrated at first because the picture was just too voraciously crisp.  Film looked like video basically until I called Samsung and we found the solution.  It was just a matter of turning down the blur reduction and jutter reduction in picture options from 5 to 3.  Unfortunately that detail is not covered in the user's manual so it took a call to their customer care line to work through it.  Very happy now.  I feel like I got an amazing amount of TV for under a grand -- delivered!

Reviews.Title: Review: Samsung 46" 120 hz. 1080p LN46C630
Reviews.Author: Sydney Holmberg
Reviews.Content: This television is one of the best in the market right now, based on the performance you receive for your money. I got it for $900, and it out performs or equals most edge-lit LED/LCD units that are hundreds of dollars more. I think what impresses me most is the picture clarity, as well as a plethora of picture options and intuitive features that are overlooked by other manufacturers. Being a gamer, I constantly tweak picture settings, and the presets provided are extremely helpful when switching between various types of media and inputs. Because the 120hz refresh rate can be jarring for things like movies, tv shows shot in video, and downloaded .avi files, I generally lower the smoothness for them. I have a PS3 connected via HDMI and the picture is staggeringly good. When gaming, I use the smooth setting on AMP(automotionplus), and the dynamic color mode, which gives you a huge advantage by making poorly lit areas clearly visible. The ability to adjust the dejudder and the blur reduction independently is awesome, and you need to play around with it a lot to get the best picture out of any media that is 720p, or if you have a game with odd frame rate issues it could resolve them or reduce their severity. SD looks really good on this tv, even better then most CRT's, especially if you concede to using the 4:3 aspect ratio. Sports look incredible on this TV, especially with the 120hz set to smooth. It should be noted, that this TV has an endless viewing angle, thanks to its matte finish. I use a Sanus full-motion wall mount and love it! The menus are quick and snappy, as well as laid out clearly. Something that has always bothered me with big-screens is the irritating lag between menu screens, and this unit does not have that problem. The media player works great for .avi files but did lock up once when connected to my external hard drive. This is most likely due to an issue with the hard drive, as I haven't had any other issues with the media player. This tv is perfect for gamers, as well as anyone who wants a big-screen 1080p HDTV with tons of options, great reliability, and that doesn't cost a fortune.

Reviews.Title: Unsustainable
Reviews.Author: Amur
Reviews.Content: This TV works great until 1 month after warranty(bough it July 2010). The LCD screen suddenly starts to flicker no matter which input (PC, HDMI, TV, CABLE) I select. I did a research on the internet and found people with similar problem ([...]). It seems the Panel Samsung used are really cheap. So if this happened to you, the TV will be a junk since it's too expensive to replace the Panel.Have your fingers crossed.Leo

Reviews.Title: WARNING - TV DOES NOT LAST!
Reviews.Author: Spencer C. Manners
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV and liked it more or less at first.  But for the past couple of weeks the screen has started to dim and flicker after the set has been on for a while.  I have a neighbor who bought the same set at the same time as I did and she is having the exact same issue.  I looked on the internet and there are many complaints about this problem.  I am becoming increasingly convinced that Samsung makes pretty, well designed products but they do not last.  Don't buy this brand!

Reviews.Title: A Very Good TV For the Money
Reviews.Author: Dante1138
Reviews.Content: When I finally decided to upgrade to a flatscreen TV, I did weeks of research, until my eyes were bleeding from reading about tech specs that made little to no sense to me.  I finally decided on this 46" Samsung LCD, both because it was a recommended best buy on CR and because of multiple glowing testimonials from friends.  Overall, I have to say that I am very, very pleased with this TV, with a few caveats, which I will describe below.  The short answer, however, is that this is a high quality, versatile TV that just about anyone will be happy with.Right now I am using an Xbox 360 for games, Netflix streaming, and DVDs while I await a Blu-Ray upgrade.  Games could not be more sublime.  Pictures are crisp, colorfol, and input response time is very good (only a few "twitch" games revealed any minor delays at all, and they were nominal).  Street Fighter IV and Pac-Man CE DX, two timing-dependent games, play very well.When streaming a movie or show in HD, the picture is phenomenal.  Couldn't be more pleased.  DVDs are pretty good too, though it depends greatly on the quality of the DVD itself.  An educated guess would be that Blu-Rays would be as good or better than the HD streaming.  This model has the auto-smooth 120hZ refresh rate, which doubles the normal framerate of shows and games, but honestly, I just leave it off.  It makes movies and shows TOO smooth, everything appears to be shot using a camcorder, and the effect is distracting.  I'm sure that for HD sports it is a worthwhile feature, though, to prevent any screen tear (though I never notice any in fast-moving films using the 60hZ setting).The Standard Def image using my cable box is fine...but by no means great.  Clarity is slightly worse than on my old CRT television.  I haven't upgraded to the HD cable yet.  Again, my educated guess is that it will be on par with the HD streaming from the Xbox, which is to say, quite good.Many people on here have complained bitterly about the sound quality from the TV speakers, but this seems to be a gripe from audiophiles who now expect everything to be in 5.1 or 7.1 surround sound.  The speakers are, for built in speakers, very serviceable.  Switching the EQ to the Movie Setting will give you a tremendous improvement over the default setting, increasing the bass and overall depth of the sound.  They are still obviously not as good as a home theater system, which would improve the clarity of dialogue and overall richness, but as stated already for built-in speakers they are just fine.  A note, however, if you plan to mount the TV on the wall: the speakers are on the back.  This is probably to help bounce sound to create a faux surround sound, but if mounted to a flat surface it could adversely affect the sound output.In the interest of full disclosure I should say that I am awaiting a replacement to the original LN46C630 that I ordered, due to an unfortunate amount of "light bleed" coming from the right hand side of the screen.  For 90% of content this is not noticeable at all, but for extremely dark scenes (esp. when watching in the dark) there is a swath on the right that is noticeably brighter than the rest of the screen.  This has to do with how the frame is bonded together (light is leaking from around the edges of the screen) and is just a fact of life with LCD screens.  Hopefully the replacement will be better, because it is my only true gripe with this set, and only then because I am a stickler for image clarity (and let's face it, I watch a lot of movies set in space, which tend to be dark :) )***EDIT - The replacement set has come in and the picture is significantly better, with much truer darks and no discernible light bleed whatsoever.  Speakers do not sound quite as crisp but some testing leads me to believe this has more to do with the external device than the set, as using external speakers for the same content produces the same result - END EDIT***The set itself is beautiful, with a very sturdy stand if you choose not to mount it, and the remote is well laid out and backlit, making it easy to use in the dark.  Overall, if the replacement is free of the light bleed issue, I will have been tremendously pleased with this purchase.  It was a significantly cheaper set than many of the others in its quality range, and issues like light bleed could hit any unfortunate LCD, it is not an issue with just this set.  It should also be noted that the return policy Amazon has is phenomenal.  They are bringing the replacement and picking up the old set within the space of one week, completely free of charge, and all it took was a 5 minute phone call to set it up.  I will come back for my future electronic purchases.Hopefully this review is helpful to anyone that, like me, was skittish about diving into such a large purchase.  Overall I would have to say that LCD is the way to go over plasma (more reliable and uses far less energy) and that Samsung is a high quality brand at an affordable price.  Happy viewing!

Reviews.Title: Good TV but Samsung is plauged with capacitor problems
Reviews.Author: Nathaniel W. Martin "NWM"
Reviews.Content: I've had my TV for maybe a month now and I've been happy with it. The online services it advertises are basically a waste of breath. There is no reason to ever use it really. The USB option for playing movies off a hard drive with the television are a good idea, but it takes too long to sort through all the media on an external and if you change the channel you have to start the movie all over again (I use the TV as a computer monitor so I flash to my messenger sometimes). Overall the TV was working well. However I'm here now writing because my TV died. Though Samsung is going to fix it for me, the earliest I can even schedual an appointment for fixing it is in four days. That's a long time without TV or PS3 folks. I did some research to see if I can reset the TV or run it through a troubleshooting process but all I can find is problems with the power supplies in all kinds of Samsungs. Basically what it looks like is if you buy a Samsung TV, hope you get lucky enough for it to die while still under warranty or you could be spending $[...] bucks to change out a capacitor; or you could do it yourself. This is a forum basically dedicated to helping people with messed up Samsungs and it talk sa lot about the problems the power supplies have had [...]By the way, there are many bad reviews of the delivery service Amazon uses for large items. Most of them are from a few years ago. I had no problems with my TV getting here it made it about 10 days early.As an update to this review my television is still inoperable. The individuals that are to fix my TV recieved faulty parts from Samsung then the parts went on back order. Additionally the people that were to fix it never put into the system that my TV was even seen for repair, which means I can't get a different TV to replace this one. I am stuck with my thousand dollar paper weight sitting in my house with no television still at this time. STAY CLEAR OF SAMSUNG.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: D. Piendak "gullivering"
Reviews.Content: Maybe I just wasn't lucky, but I got two of these TV's and in each case the screen was faulty.On the first one, the right side of the screen was considerably brighter than the left. This was particularly annoying during night scenes and while watching in a low-light room.On the second one, there was a 1 inch vertical strip that glowed brighter than the rest of the display about 6 inches from the edge of the screen.These might be minor complaints, but if Im gonna spend near a grand for a TV I expect I high quality product. Boo Samsung.On the plus side, Amazon has been fantastic with the return process.

Reviews.Title: Bad product (stopped working after 12 months), bad Samsung service
Reviews.Author: Marc
Reviews.Content: What a conincidence. 1 year and 1 weeks after I bought this TV (i.e. 1 week out of warranty) the image starts flickering making it impossible to watch TV. Very disappointed, these TVs should work for years without issues. Of course Samsung declines the warranty claim because it is one week after the 12 month warranty period. And here is the best part: The closest "Samsung Service Center" is 20 miles from where I live (with in metropolitan Southern California). Last time I bought Samsung. Bad product and bad service. And, I am also reconsidering buying electronics at Amazon. They don't help with problems either. BestBuy would have helped with get it fixed without having to drive 20 miles...

Reviews.Title: Tell my wife everyday..."God I love my new TV"
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: I researched to the point of driving myself nuts for a new hd tv. It was between this one and an LG comparative. So I went to best buy for some visual comparison and ended up buying this one one through Amazon and couldn't be happier.I was really focused on picture quality, reliability, and ease of use with my new TV as I wanted to spend less than 1000 bucks but still buy quailty. I know usually the two have a hard time working together.....Samsung has always had great reviews in way of reliability, and my personal experience has been pretty good with customer service. This tv rated quite high on consumer reports and cnet. Please also realize all HD tv companys now suffer around a 3% failure rate. So far after 3 weeks I have no issues, all samsungs are known for having a slow start up time, I knew this going in, so the 5-10 seconds or so it takes to say "Hi" to me isn't bothersome.When comparing this tv to some of the newer edge lit LEDs I found this TV to have not only better picture clarity, but also truer blacks, greens and browns, very comparative to a panasonic S2 and g25 plasma I was looking at. In fact, of all the LCD's I looked at this one captured the true colors the best. All the led tv's, although vibrant, tended to wash out the lighter browns and greens to the point of making everything look cartoony.As far as the dreaded LCD image blur, well it is there, but you have to look for it. I do not see it while watching football, basketball, or normal hd telvision--where I notice it the most is while watching hockey. The contrast of the fast speed, and dark uniforms against white ice presents a slight edge blur when looked for. However as said you have to loook for it and hockey has never looked so good in my house! You will litterally see every slice in the ice, and every scratch on thier helmets. As for The tru motion thing/soap opera---shut it off its awful and I have found no good use for it.With HD programming this tv is utterly amazing, I find myself watching the travel channel, discovery channel, nat geo and most of all palladia to watch concerts in HD with utter aww. You litterally feel like you are in the crowd. Streamed netflix looks incredible as well.As for setup the tv sets very easily on its quite beautiful glass stand. I used the AmazonBasics High Speed HDMI Cable (6.5 Feet / 2.0 Meters) - Supports Ethernet, 3D, and Audio Return [NEW MODEL] X 2  for my FIOS DVR box and PS3 and have found everything to be plug and play with no issues what so ever. I have my TV setting on a oak stand/cabinet that is in the corner of the room and it is a wonderful presence. The TV has a wonderful built in menu system to adjust everything to your liking, and although the remote is a simple candy bar, it is quite funtional, balances in the hand well, and will fine tune your tv into and littleral mesmerizing experiance.Sound: I researched my tail off settling on that I was going to have to buy a Sony HT-CT150 3D Sound Bar System,as according to everything I read flat screen sound is awful, however I am glad I didn't. The sound on this tv is very very good, I rarely have to raise my volume to anything more than 15. It is clear, because of its location in the corner of my room and the back projected sound you even get some surround sound effect from it. Voice clarity is perfect, bass although not outsatnding, is quite acceptable for built in speakers.My wife surprised me with a PlayStation 3 320GB System with PlayStation Move Bundle, this past week and I am truly amazed at the image quality on this tv, and the tv's game mode sharpens it even more! Using the ps3 has allowed as said before net flix and internet capability. allowing me to not have to spend more on a tv to get those features that quite frankly would clutter this wonderful tv's simple pure, fantastic image producing quality.Because it was in the stars review I will say the only thing I didn't like about my Amazon/TV experience was the delivery. Yes they were on time, however they came on the wrong day(they did call the night before which allowed me to rearrange my sched), they did not wipe their feet before stepping on my light tan carpet(its winter here), and they simplay dropped the tv off. Althought I undertsand this is all that is required, pilot shipping un packed, and verified my good friends plasma tv working ability for him before they left his home. I could have opened the box to find a shattered screen. Like I said I know this is not a requirement, but it would have been nice to not have that uneasy feeling as I opened the box, knowing that I may have a big hassle on my hands, rather than just not signing for something and have them take it from my home. However this is not worth removing a star from this tv, as it is the shipper not the tv.Overall, if your looking for simple, pure, beautiful, picture with adequate sound, for a good price this is your tv.

Reviews.Title: One year and 5 months
Reviews.Author: Thomas M. Demyan "lx302"
Reviews.Content: One year and 5 months of viewing a nice TV. Then the flickering started!It is unexceptable for a unit this new to develop a problem like this.I did some research before I bought this TV and decided to take a chance of the odds I had of developing a problem.  Well I lost.I did some post research now, and based on others having the same issue, the flicking is due to faulty parts on the power supply board.  Most probably the capacitors.  Not having the necessary tool to diagnose them, I ordered a complete power supply board for my unit and intend to install it myself.I'll keep you posted on the fix once I receive the board and do the install.Wish me luck!Update:  I received the Power Supply Board today and installed it in 15 mins.  You want to look for Part Number BN44-00341B if your going to try the fix yourself.  All you need is a screwdriver.  Lay the TV down face down. After removing all the screws off the back, remove the 3 plugs on the power supply and a couple more screws.  Reinstall the back and your done.  My TV works fine again.  Wheew.  Lets see how long it lasts on this Power supply board.

Reviews.Title: Love love this tv
Reviews.Author: Paul R. Briggs
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on LCD tvs with the following criteria: Under $1000, 46-52" and 1080/120. In the end, I went with the Samsung brand because its reputation for quality and I can't be happier with this model.  I have DirecTV and the HD picture quality is incredible; it puts my 42" plasma 720 to shame.  I have a blu ray player hooked up to it and regular non blu ray DVDs still look awesome.  I told my wife that I couldn't believe they were regular DVDs.  Watching from an angle didn't affect the quality either which was a concern with some of the tvs I looked at.I agonized over this choice for a while but in the end I couldn't be happier. I'm tempted to replace my plasma immediately with this tv.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Ilya-X
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing TV for the price, and is currently listed by CNET as one of the top 20 best HDTVs overall.The picture is phenomenal. LCD screen looks very uniform, and colors come off very sharp. Fairly good picture even at an angle, though not quite as clear as looking from dead center. The picture is NOT very good out of the box, however, and you'll definitely need to adjust some things (too much brightness, skin tones too pink, etc). Luckily, the TV gives you a LOT of customization of the picture, much more than any other comparable model I've looked at. I'm using the following settings, and think they are a noticeable improvement over the default settings:Picture Mode: MovieColor Temp: NormalBrightness: 47Contrast: 95Color:  49Tint:  G49/R51Sharpness: 0Backlight: 7Red - Offset 28Green - Offset 25Blue - Offset 16Red - Gain 17Green - Gain 25Blue - Gain 21This TV also includes a setting called AutoMotion Plus, which greatly smooths out the picture. On the downside, when this feature is enabled, it makes everything look like it's filmed with a home camcorder. This is what some people refer to as the "soap opera effect". Movies look like behind-the-scenes footage, etc. I find this feature to be absolutely worthless, since it ruins immersion and is very distracting. In most cases, it's nothing more than a fun gimmick, although people who watch sports or reality television shows might enjoy it because it doesn't change the look of the visual presentation (from film to home video) and simply smooths out the existing picture. In rare cases, I've seen quick stutter every 5 seconds when this feature is enabled, as if the TV isn't quite powerful enough to handle this level of picture processing. Note that this setting is enabled BY DEFAULT, and if you don't like it as much as me, you will need to turn it off for every one of your inputs since picture settings are not global.The audio speakers are about equal to any built-in TV speakers you've ever heard. The bass is very limited (no subwoofer, obviously), but stereo effect is much more pronounced than what I'm used to, which I like a lot. TV has several options to enhance sound, including several simulated "surround sound" settings. These can be used to greatly enhance bass levels, but I've noticed that it makes dialogue in movies sound less natural and more synthetic, since these settings seem to basically be equalizer presets and change how sound sounds at various frequencies. I find myself generally keeping all the surround sound settings disabled and think that default sound is very good on its own.I use Comcast's service for my television feed, with their Cisco cable box connected through HDMI. In general, their picture looks very good on this screen, though the HD channels looks somewhat more murky than even 720p resolution, despite the fact that the TV is reporting that the cable box is sending it's signal at 1080i. Comcast just doesn't have enough bandwidth to deliver quality HD picture, so this is not the TV's fault. If you want to experience the full power of this TV, the only way to go is with Blu-Ray or gaming consoles.Besides television, I connected an Xbox 360 to the TV via the Xbox 360 VGA HD AV Cable. This cable plugs into the TV's PC video and audio inputs, and offers 1080p resolution (1920x1080) with 0 controller lag. A benefit of this cable is that it upscales regular DVD the way expensive DVD players do, giving very crisp picture on this TV fairly close to Blu-Ray quality, though not as detailed. If you connect game consoles with HDMI or component cable, you might experience some controller lag, but this TV includes "Game Mode" which removes some of the advanced picture processing (AutoMotion Plus, etc) in order to reduce that lag.This TV can connect to your home network with an ethernet cable (WiFi dongle sold separately) to stream media from your computer, but does not get online to connect to internet services like Netflix or YouTube. If this matters to you, you can buy one of dozens of Blu-Ray players that have extensive Internet features and just use that, or use a PS3 or Xbox 360 for Netflix, etc. I personally don't care that the TV itself can't access those online services on its own.Overall, every feature of the TV I didn't like is optional (though, oddly, AutoMotion Plus was enabled by default out of the box). I can't force myself to complain about these extraneous gimmicks too much when some TVs don't even offer them, and others offer the same exact bonus features that don't work any better. And don't kid yourself, the majority of these features ARE gimmicks. But as far as what actually matters, the TV offers amazing picture (given a good source) and very good sound for the price.As far as delivery, I chose the "free" option rather than expedited service. The estimate given by Amazon was 9 days. Delivery was handled by third party shippers, who called me on day 8 to let me know that they'll be deliver the TV 13 days after I placed my order. The day before delivery, they called again to give me a 4-hour window to be at home, and arrived on time, 13 days after my order was placed. They took TV to the room I specified, took it out of the box to show me it was not damaged, but did not attach it to the swivel stand. I knew to expect that, but just giving people details of what they get with Amazon TV delivery. Overall, I was not very happy that it took this long to deliver, but it did arrive in one piece and I saved a lot of money with free shipping and no sales tax, so that balances it out.

Reviews.Title: LOVE my first HDTV
Reviews.Author: Jason Brinkle
Reviews.Content: Like many others here, I did a LOT of homework and pricing before deciding to get this particular TV.  This is also my first HDTV.  CEVA was very prompt with scheduling an appointment and delivered it at the beginning of the time window.  The TV is very easy to unbox and installing the stand was a cinch.  Out of the box, picture quality was excellent compared to what I used to have on my 32 inch Toshiba CRT.  The remote is not the greatest looking thing in the world, but it is very easy to use and the button layout is extremely comfortable and functional.  The sound on this set is very rich and also an improvement over my old TV.  But, the thing that really made me glad I got this TV was when I hooked up my new Blu-ray player and watched The Dark Knight.  I was simply blown away by the picture quality.  I will only be satisfied watching Blu-ray movies at home now!  To say the least, I am very satisfied with my purchase.If you need a place to discuss this TV or ideas on calibration settings or other HDTV topics, I've found that AVS Forum is a great place to go.

Reviews.Title: Not for OTA..but otherwise a good set.
Reviews.Author: Ray Wells
Reviews.Content: We bought the TV online, and returned the first within a week.  The second has the same problem the first one did, and we were offered a refund and declined.  This TV (others in forums beg for help with the problem) is not good for OTA users.  When a weak channel gets pixelated and the signal drops, the tuner locks out all channels.  The only way to get reception is then to turn it off (which at this stage takes 3 times longer than normal) and back on.  Samsung does not appear to log in this problem yet, because they told me they had no record of it being a problem.  However, the service company coming to repair it says they'll have to order a new tuner before they can come.  I've had this second one 2 weeks.  Last night I had to turn it off 25 times in 2 hours.  If all your channels are strong, it might not ever be a problem.  If you have marginal signal strength on some you watch, I'd think twice about buying this--UNLESS THEY FIND THE PROBLEM. I have other TVs that just drop the channel, then come back in a few seconds.  You'll lose about 45 seconds each time this happens.

Reviews.Title: beware
Reviews.Author: Brian J. Young
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv for my parents in 2010. the picture was great and the unit was nice. But after only about a year and a half the LCD screen suddenly starts to flicker. I did a research on the internet and found this to be a common problem with Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Bummer...
Reviews.Author: Troy McKelvey
Reviews.Content: I loved this TV!  But just like others have said, 1 year and 2 months after purchasing, the screen flickers.  Just imagine all the white areas of the picture flashing at you like a strobe light. Samsung is no help and they don't seem to care that this has happened to many of these TV's (according to Internet search).  Bummer...

Reviews.Title: Great TV for gaming, sports, and Blu-ray
Reviews.Author: mdubya "mdubya"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV about a month ago to replace an old Sharp 32" LCD that had stopped working. I also had recently moved into a new house with a much larger living room, so I wanted to upgrade in screen size.My primary interest in the TV purchase was to have a TV that would work great for video games. I have an Xbox 360, PS3, and Wii all plugged into this TV. Due to the fact that I have 3 video game systems hooked up to the TV and that I have FiOS cable, I couldn't care less about the TV having internet connectivity, widgets, or any of that stuff.I also was crossing shopping this TV with the 46" offerings from Sony and LG, as well as the Panasonic plasmas. After evaluating reviews and going with what I thought was the best picture I chose this Samsung.I could not be happier. The picture and features on this TV blow me away. Auto Motion Plus seems to work great for gaming and sports, be it football, basketball, or hockey, but Auto Motion Plus does make normal TV shows look amusingly awkward. This feature can easily be toggled on and off when necessary though.In terms of gaming, its great. I think that Red Dead Redemption is one of the prettiest games out there right now - and this TV makes the game look positively stunning. Halo Reach, Uncharted 2 - it doesn't matter what you play, you will be happy with this TV.This Samsung even makes the decidedly average Wii graphics look good. Wii Sports Resort looks nice, Metroid Other M is decent, and Red Steel 2 is very impressive. With this TV, Red Steel 2 could even be mistaken for a 360 or PS3 game in terms of graphical quality.Obviously Blu-Ray looks great too.There is a lot of talk between LED and CCFL backlighting. I personally think that this TV blows away the side-lit LEDs in terms of picture quality and brightness/black levels. The "good" LED TVs are in a different price bracket, so I won't bother comparing them.I also have this TV in a reasonably bright room, and I have no issue with seeing the screen due to ambient lighting conditions.In terms of problems with this TV, I can only see one issue: the speakers. They're terrible. Don't even bother thinking that you can deal with them. You are doing yourself and your $1k TV investment a disservice.I bought the Sony HTCT150 soundbar. It has great sound, and matches the quality of the TV.On the plus side in terms of sound, this Samsung has an optical out jack in the back - so if you have a sound system, you just plug in an optical audio cable and you are good to go.I have my cable box, PS3, and 360 all plugged into the rear HDMI ports, and the Wii plugged into one of the rear Component ports. The optical audio out seamlessly delivers the sound to the soundbar no matter what TV input I am using.If you don't have a sound system, just budget ~$300 more, buy a soundbar, and be done with it.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding LCD
Reviews.Author: happy customer
Reviews.Content: I've had my 630 LCD for about a month and it looks great! I've been waiting to see if I found something that I didn't like, so that I could include it in my review, but I haven't found anything so far.I went with the 630 Samsung LN46C630 46-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LCD HDTV (Black), since the only internet app that I was super interested in was Netflix and I can get that through my Wii anyway. I haven't found myself wanting other apps yet, but if I do, I'll just get an internet capable blu ray, since many of the better quality ones have that capability.In summary: don't waste your money on an internet capable TV, unless it is a built-in capability packaged with something that you really want (e.g. 3D, if you're into that) or it doesn't cost you much. For me, it wasn't worth the extra $90. You can always pick up the internet through another device that you'll end up buying anyway.

Reviews.Title: Buy Samsung if you want to catch-up on reading and playing board games
Reviews.Author: Jko
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV in May 2010 from Amazon.com.  The price was good (it has not gone down much since then, though, which is surprising), and overall, I was fairly satisfied with the TV in the first year of ownership.  I was not blown away with the quality.  Of note, the picture, even for sports which is my primary viewing interest, was what I would characterize as good to very good.  The audio (not enhanced with separate speakers etc) was somewhat underwhelming, but I am not that concerned with a home theater experience.The reason I am writing a review (I am normally a free-rider who is keen to peruse other reviews but I do not usually comment whether satisfied or not) is to warn people about durability concerns.  This TV only lasted slightly less than 18 months.  When my partner contacted the folks at Samsung, she was informed it was out of warranty.  The problem has grown progressively worse, and the cost of a site visit (just to diagnose any problem) is $150 and the repair could cost more.  I have tried a progressive series of troubleshooting measures, per the Samsung directions, but no measures fix the TV.  It continues to flicker and dim (rendering it unwatchable).  When I spoke with someone in Samsungs' "executive services" (not sure what that refers to since I am not an executive but merely a dissatisfied consumer), I was fed the same line my wife was regarding the warranty only being good for one year.  I asked the representative if that is typical for a Samsung product because I don't expect a big screen TV purchase to fall into the annual purchases category of running shoes and britta filters and the only response was an apology, but not a defense of their product.There are online fixes suggested (basically taking apart components and cutting cables that according to the online fixes should have been disconnected at manufacture), and I will give this a try.  Even if these consumer-made fixes work, that does not excuse Samsung from unleashing a faulty product and not standing by it.  Be sure to read reviews of any Samsung TV you consider, from what I saw online, this was not the only model to experience these issues.

Reviews.Title: Plan on buying another tv in less than 2 years.
Reviews.Author: bjhutch
Reviews.Content: I bought this Tv before Christmas in 2010, and it did fine until about two weeks ago. The channels change on there own,  the volume goes up and down on its own, the source will change,  it will cut off and on and it will change to store mode. I looked online to see if there were any recalls and found none. What I did find was that I am not the only person having this problem. There are many people with the same complaints with Samsung tvs. I contacted Samsung and they said all they would do is send someone to fix it but I had to pay for it. I told them that this is unacceptable since it seems to be a manufacturing defect. I was told that someone else would call me in 24 hours. They did not and I had to call them. They then told me that there was nothing they could do but pay for parts and they even acknowledged that I was not the only one with this problem. In conclusion,  I will NEVER buy another Samsung product nor recommend one. They do not make quality products or seem to care about the consumer. Customer service was horrible. Save your money and frustration.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Great Price!
Reviews.Author: Frank M.
Reviews.Content: After realizing that 3D TV gives me motion-sickness, I decided that it was the time to complete my home theatre with a 46" TV. We had a Samsung soundbar system and blu-ray player, so I was fairly sure I wanted to stay with that same brand. I was dead-set on getting one that was LED backlit. Consumer reports ranked this one as the highest non-LED TV, however, so I thought I'd check it out.In the store, I couldn't discern much of a difference between this model and the much more expensive LED backlit one next to it, also by Samsung. I must have stood there and looked at them for 20 minutes or more. Both were on sale, but this one was significantly less expensive and I decided it would meet my needs.The picture is awesome. Menus are fairly easy to use, though it takes some tinkering to figure out which options you want (see technical note below). The blacks fade slightly to grey when you view the TV at a wide angle, but this is a minor concern to me. Travel BD disks like Over Ireland [Blu-ray] are amazing and movies are so good that I'm addicting to buying blu-ray disks now. Though I'm not much of a football fan, I've been watching bits and pieces of the games because it feels like you're right on the field with the players.Sound quality is mediocre. It is better than our 37" Samsung, but we owned a 37" Panasonic that sounded as if it had a soundbar in it. For regular TV watching it is satisfactory. We have a Samsung HW-C450 Soundbar Speaker home theater system, so if we're watching a movie we have the option to create a true home theatre sound and visual experience.I'm satisfied with all of the features. Our Samsung BD-C5500 1080p Blu-ray Disc Player connects to the internet, so I didn't need the internet connectivity on the TV. I was surprised to find that the TV would detect computers through the home network and play music or pictures on those machines just like the BD player can.TECHNICAL NOTE: One thing that impressed me about these TVs was the motion-smoothing feature. I thought it looked good in the store, and made that a required feature for my TV purchase. When I got the TV home and started to tried it out, I found that everything, even the Empire Strikes Back, looked like a cheap 1970s video production. After researching this problem on the internet, I learned about the "Soap Opera Effect", which is neutralized by turning OFF the motion smoothing feature. There are two levels of motion-smoothing on the TV (and I believe the lower level is the default setting), so if the picture is disappointing you try adjusting this feature to see if the picture improves.I've had this TV for just over a month. This is a good deal. This TV performs well above its price range.

Reviews.Title: Great value.
Reviews.Author: Laura M. Howard
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research. I wanted something easy right out of the box, because although I'm not a techno-idiot, I'm not a wizard either. The on-screen functions are user-friendly, and what doesn't make sense can be de-mystified by looking at the old-fashioned paper manual that came with it. I liked that. I suppose the sound would not be acceptable for a lot of people, but I hooked it to my surround sound system with optical cable, so it's great. Picture quality is very good, especially in HD. If you want to pay for the super-bright LED picture, that's great; but I'm happy with this LCD, and I've heard the dependability and life of a LCD is better than LED. (Although I have no actual evidence for this.) Hook-up is a breeze. They delivered within 2 days of what was estimated; a local guy came out, unpacked it and made sure it was working before he left. Very nice. I had read Amazon reviews before I purchased, which were extremely helpful, so I'll pass along a couple of things that made a real difference for me: If you don't like the "soap opera" motion effect, you need to disable the auto-motion plus feature. Also, if you notice the picture go dim, it's because the auto-adjust ambient light feature is enabled. I didn't like it, so I disabled that, too. (My sister actually returned her TV because she thought something was wrong with it; oddly, the big box store salesperson didn't know how to fix it. Hmmmm...) I was a little nervous about ordering something so big and expensive online, but Amazon came through like it always has for me over many years of ordering books. Plus, the savings just by not having to pay tax is enough to take the risk. Oh yeah, one more tip...order the TV with a credit card that has extended warranty service--it will double the warranty from one year to two.

Reviews.Title: Good value for money
Reviews.Author: David Worsley
Reviews.Content: This was our first flat-screen HD television, replacing an old 27 inch tube model.  I did a fair amount of research and determined that this particular model was the best value for our money.  This is not the most current technology (i.e. not LED or 3D).  This is in fact an advantage of this set in that the prices for LCD-only TVs have come down with the introduction of LED and 3D TVs.  And as we are planning to use this television just for general viewing LED and 3D are totally unnecessary.The HD picture quality is excellent.  I was a little worried about the much talked about panel lottery being a problem.  We wound up with an AA06 panel, which turns out to provide wonderful picture quality with great color and very good off-angle viewing.  There are many user controls which affect the picture quality.  The one I like the best is the ECO setting which, when enabled, automatically brightens/dims the backlight according to the ambient light in the room.  This means that we can see the picture full daylight and not be blinded by it at night, all without having to actively manage the brightness setting ourselves.  I'm not so far a big fan of the Motion Flow feature and have, for now, disabled it.  For the most part it has little obvious (positive) effect on general programming.The sound of the set is a little "tinny", even after playing around with the numerous audio controls.  In the end I connected the audio output of the television to our home theater system, and the sound quality is no longer an issue.  However one thing that I do find annoying is that the audio output is unamplified and does not mute when the main TV speakers are muted.  This is a minor issue.Though I have not yet played with the network connectivity features, I have played several videos of the kids' concerts generated from Windows Movie Maker program  The video playback from a USB stick, is perfect with no delay or stuttering.  In addition the slideshow feature works great to show photos.  I look forward to adding a Wifi bridge so that we can view all of our digital media from our computer network.We have had this set for about three weeks now, and so far it has met all of our expectations.  At this point I would recommend this set for anyone who is looking for a television providing excellent picture quality, generous features without wanting to pay the premium for LED or 3D functionality.

Reviews.Title: Best TV for the price
Reviews.Author: br
Reviews.Content: I bought this Tv because it was a "known" brand. It was a good price for the features and size and quality, and it was beautiful. I went to the local TV spot and checked them all out and this on caught my eye. I read through the reviews and most were really "techy" so I went a different route, does it do what i want it to well, will it not be obsolete in a year or so (that remains to be seen) and does it have the functions that i will be able to use and modify if needed in an easy and efficient way. This one does just fine. I've had no problems with this TV since I set it up, but at first you really need time to adjust it because it's presets need it. You have to turn off the motion thing or it will drive you crazy, its not even worth it for sports because it makes everyone look superhuman, so watching sports with my DVR, I watched a portion with it on and then off, big difference...and the real one is just fine. Other adjustments are the luminescence and black balance. once these are straightened out ( each room is different) the set is awesome. No matter what you watch or play, the TV shows well. I would recommended it for sure.

Reviews.Title: LCD over Edge-lit LED
Reviews.Author: Corey G.
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a TV to finally enjoy my living room area for several months and I was hell bent on getting an LED.  I originally purchased the LG 42LE5400 edge-lit LED and thought I was going to be enjoying my new set with sytle.  That TV was absolutely horrible and I wouldn't wish edge-lit LED tv's for anyone that enjoys movies with any kind of dark scenes and viewing angles.  So I decided to return it and get the Samsung LN46C630...BEST thing I ever did!For the price you get more screen, better picture uniformity and a clean interface with fast switching between input devices.  Movies look unbelievable!!!  I test (unofficially) my tv's with Dark Knight since that is heavy on the dark scenes and it shows this movie extremely well.  It can produce a pretty bright screen and the picture was almost flawless right out the box!  No netflix and apps, but I think its better to have this feature in another device like a Blue-Ray player.  The sound is pretty good for the TV. Sound is pretty sharp and doesn't make me rush out and get a home theater system.I would definitely suggest this TV for anyone and Samsung is a trusted brand.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Malackai
Reviews.Content: First big ticket item I've ordered sight unseen.  Delivery was fast and within the provided time window.  Rated 4 stars just because I haven't had it that long, and I'm unfamiliar with other models.  The set meets or exceeds all of my expectations.  I got an "S" panel.Pros:  The picture is very crisp even in standard definition and lower frequencies.  The HD sometimes has an almost 3D effect.  I've never had HD before so it's like a whole new world.  I'm no audiophile, so the stock speakers/sound is sufficient.  Even at relatively low sound levels (ie 10-15, which is maybe 25% of the max volume), it's loud and clear.  Plenty of inputs (3 or 4 HDMI, component, RCA, USB, VGA, etc), and the panel is set up so all are easily accessible.  Didn't notice much of an upgrade w/ my Xbox 360 when plugged into componenet, but on HDMI it brought out so much detail and color (note: may not have anything to do with the TV, I don't know).  The menus are relatively straight forward.  The finish and look is nice as well.  I got a clear base stand which looks good, almost like the set floats over the base.  It's light enough for a 1-man carry.Cons: The remote is quite bulky and slightly confusing, imo.  I won't use it much anyway.  The power input could be lower and more centralized, the port is situated far to one side, so you may need a longer cord for your situation.  For whatever reason, the string/screw that tethers the set from falling forward simply doesn't fit (have tried all the holes).  That's really it thus far.Other:  Don't be afraid to tighten the screws down hard with the plastic base.  I was worried about cracking the plastic, and the result was the set wobbled left and right.  Had to take it apart again and tighten them down more.  I do wish the tether worked, but that's very minor.  It's definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: failed after 2 years - picture flickering/strobing
Reviews.Author: C. Stephens
Reviews.Content: This TV was wonderful for the first two years I owned it. Excellent image, nice controls, plenty of inputs. Then after about 20 months it would occasionally flicker (more like a strobe light). It got progressively worse and worse until it flickered constantly and therefore was unwatchable.If you google the model number of this TV the first thing that comes up is lots of reports of flickering - it is a very widespread problem.Fortunately I had an extended warranty through Square Trade and it was fixed under warranty (Square Trade was great, by the way). The technician replaced the power supply board. I wonder if the replacement board is the same as the original and will fail in another 2 years?The takeaways for me are: (a) Samsung TV quality is questionable (a nearly $1000 TV fails in less than 2 years???), and (b) I'd recommend anyone purchasing a Samsung TV also purchase an extended warranty and just consider that part of the cost of the TV.--NOTE: There are lots of reports on the web of folks cutting a jumper on the power supply board and stopping the flickering. Allegedly there is an "official" Samsung service bulletin about this, but I can find noone who's actually produced a copy of this and my technician hadn't heard of it, and Samsung is mum on the issue. So I remain skeptical of that fix. Maybe it fixes the problem, but why is the jumper there in the first place if it can be cut? What does it do? Does cutting it lead to other problems or shorten then life of other components?. Since my TV was under warranty I went to a technician for a proper repair. If the problem happens again then I'll probably just replace the power supply board myself. It was a quick & easy job - no soldering.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working after 18 months!
Reviews.Author: Steven S
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV about 18 months ago. Up until last month, I would have given this TV 4-5 stars but just last month the screen went black. Absolutely no picture at all, only sound.This is the second Samsung LCD TV we've purchased in the past 2 years and just this past week the other one has also had a problem (vertical lines).Having worked in the consumer electronics industry, I can tell you there is a wide variance in the amount of reliability and simulated life testing that companies are willing to perform. Based on all of the consumer complaints for problems on multiple different Samsung TV models and model years, it seems as if Samsung designs, tests, and selects the components for their TVs to last until just after the warranty period. I don't think they understand that people buy a TV to keep it for years and not as a disposable commodity.I would not recommend buying another Samsung given the poor reliability. If you are going to buy one, get an extended warranty that lasts at least 3 years and save yourself hundreds of dollars!

Reviews.Title: Bug in my Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: BKC
Reviews.Content: We bought our Samsung HD TV in April 2010.  It worked like a champ, with a beautiful picture and great sound--right up until a month AFTER the warranty expired when, in the middle of a program, the screen suddenly went black.  The audio still worked; but after a few minutes that, too, quit.  We finally called a repairman to fix a 13-month-old TV. (We have not heard back from him yet, but early indications are it will need hundreds of dollars worth of repair!)  I expected a great deal more from Samsung, but a visit to their website revealed that this is not an isolated incident.  My advice to anyone buying this model: get the extended warranty!  You may be happy that you did!

Reviews.Title: Good value LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Goo
Reviews.Content: I spent about a month researching LCD TV's, reading hundreds of reviews from dozens of sources and watching prices go up and down. I looked hard at LED edge-lit and back-lit models. Edge-lit LED screens seem to have a risk of developing edge blooming although most people appear to be happy with them. Back-lit LED screens with intelligent brightness control can provide outstanding contrast ratios on paper but not so much in practice. This TV uses traditional cold-cathode flourescent tubes for backlighting.  They're not as efficient as LEDs but I think they have better spectral output and uniformity. The difference in efficiency is not huge.I seriously considered all brands but after looking at many reviews this Samsung appeared to have significantly fewer instances of Dead-On-Arrival sets, or sets developing problems shortly after arrival. I own two other Samsung LCD TVs. They are working as well now as when I purchased them about 3 years ago. My LNT3253H has been turned on almost every day for about 6 hours. No dead pixels or other problems yet.This new model looked great in a local retail store but Amazon had the better price and delivery was included. The delivery was handled by a professional and courteous crew, arriving 3 business days after I ordered the TV. They were happy to put it where I wanted it although I didn't ask them to negotiate any flights of stairs or deal with any animals.The TV was easy to set up on a flat surface. The included stand does not swivel.  The rectangular base has a footprint of 11 x 22 inches.  The quick-start instructions are clear and easy to follow.  Out of the box the picture wasn't great but a few minutes of adjustment did the trick.  The picture settings are different for over-the-air digital signals verses the analog signal I get from my low-def satellite box. They must be adjusted separately (a good thing).The default motion-smoothing mode (Auto Motion Plus in the Picture menu) did not work well for my analog satellite signals. It actually made things very jerky. I turned it off. The analog picture was fine after that. I left Auto Motion on for digital TV signals. It seems to help there.Sound and picture qualities are reasonably good compared to everything else out there.  Overall this is probably one of the best values, having one of best chances of not requiring service or replacement early in the life of the product.

Reviews.Title: TV flickers after 8 months.
Reviews.Author: Victor
Reviews.Content: After some research I decided to go with this model. I was very happy for the first 8 months and then the flickering happened. At first it wasn't flickering a lot but it got worse over time. Every time I turned the tv on it would begin flickering after 20 minutes. Very annoying. So I called the support and they fixed within a week.I now have to buy extended warranty because if I had to pay for the service it would have cost me:Labor $220Parts $200 - 300Total = $420 - 520.The tv is assembled/manufactured in Mexico. The parts the service person replaced were also manufactured in Mexico.I appreciate others taking the time to write their reviews so here is my contribution.Victor

Reviews.Title: Flawed on arrival
Reviews.Author: Ed the Infidel "Old Bachelor"
Reviews.Content: The TV was delivered later than promised but the weather was probably a factor in slowing up its shipment. After setting it up, I could not get an image on the screen.  I called Samsung's customer service number, was dealt with efficiently by a knowledgeable rep, and set up with a house call.  The repairman called promptly, set up a time to arrive and was here within the time frame.  He quickly diagnosed the problem, zipped open the unit with a power screwdriver, and replaced what he called the "power board."  He and his assistant were here less than half an hour.  I was duly impressed with the response by Samsung.The TV is great, it's rated a good buy by Consumer Reports magazine, and I am a well-satisfied customer.

Reviews.Title: Super Bowl Ready
Reviews.Author: Nightingale "Nursing is my bag"
Reviews.Content: We have had numerous Samsung TVs in the past and have always been satisfied with the quality.  This TV was mounted in our family room for a football party. We purchased a sound bar to increase the volume and intensity and this was awesome!  My review isnt so much with the TV as it is with Amazon.com.  We have been loyal customers and have never experienced a problem with our orders.  This TV came within three days. We received timely emails and a call from the trucking company. The TV was carried into our house in pristine condition. I can't say enough on the ease and convenience of ordering anything through Amazon.com.  I have never been disappointed in service, quality or price.

Reviews.Title: This is a GREAT TV!  If you're on the fence, BUY IT!!
Reviews.Author: MotorMan
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that I am not a videophile or expert in electronics, although I do conduct quite a bit of research on electronic products before making a purchase.  Neither am I being compensated by Amazon or Samsung in any way for writing this review.  In fact, this is the first review I have written for any product on Amazon.That being said, I felt compelled to write this review due to my overwhelming satisfaction with this product and Amazon as a company.  I have owned this TV for only a month now, so this review will be made in the context of an initial impression.When I was considering making a purchase of this kind on Amazon, I was apprehensive about having such a large and expensive item shipped to my home, particularly after reading some of the less than stellar reviews about the CEVA freight service that Amazon uses to ship large items.  Not only did the TV arrive as scheduled, but the delivery driver took the time to bring it into the house and upstairs to the room where it was going to be used.  He was very friendly while he unpacked the TV, set it up and ensured it was working properly before he left.  I was very pleased with this level of service, which is supposed to be included on TVs that are larger than a certain size.The TV was extremely easy to set up.  I had it up and running within 10 minutes of connecting the power.  The interface and remote are intuitive and easy to figure out.  There are a number of adjustable picture settings that make this TV very customizable to your personal preferences.Since I have had it, I have connected a High Def cable box and XBOX 360 to it and have had the opportunity to view the picture through both sources.  I must say that the picture on this set is incredible.  I currently own 3 other LCD sets (made by Vizio and Dynex) and compared several 46" TVs by different manufacturers prior to buying this set, and the picture quality and vividness of the colors on this Samsung leave all the others that I have seen in the dust.Before buying this TV on Amazon, I searched local big box stores to see if I could find it at a comparable price and avoid the shipping, but Amazon had the lowest price I could find beat by almost $150.  Add that to the fact that you don't have to pay sales tax and it ships for free and this purchase was a no-brainer for me.If you are condsidering buying a 46" LCD TV, choose this one.  You will be very happy that you did.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Mark P. Bartlett "mpb"
Reviews.Content: I love the TV.  It was easy to set up and figure out with one exception.  I couldn't figure out how to connect my stereo amp/receiver. I know how to do this and have done it with all my other systems.  I am dissapointed in Samsung Customer support.  the woman I talked to was not knowledgable. She offered a call back from the upper tier of support. That was last evening. No call back yet 15 hours later. Love the Tv not the Samsung support.

Reviews.Title: I'm loving my new Samsung HDTV!
Reviews.Author: Andrew A. Daniels "Cydric"
Reviews.Content: This Samsung HDTV was an impulse buy for me and I'm very glad I did it. I bought the 46" Samsung to replace my 32" 720p Sony Bravia I bought about 5 years ago for the same price I just paid for this Samsung. So far I'm a very satisfied customer.
