This tv blows my Sony Bravia away! I love the stylish look of this television. I'm primarily using my new Samsung for gaming on my Xbox 360. It makes all the games I play look absolutely great! Especially Gears of War 2. I play a lot of Horde mode and the graphics are stunning on this tv.The only gripe I have about my whole experience is the delivery service Amazon used to have my HDTV delivered to me or the only one that was available where I live. They said they would deliver my tv between 9am - noon, It showed up at 4:30 pm. Good thing I had the day off.

Reviews.Title: Overall, a good buy
Reviews.Author: doho
Reviews.Content: TV was received on time and in good condition.  Delivery guys were prepared to install/set-up, but we didn't have the room ready for it yet.  Once we did perform the set-up, it was very simple.  Like others have said, having two people when mounting the TV to the swivel base is helpful.  Connections were very simple.  Everything seemed to work very well right away.We're still dialing-in the picture settings.  The good news is that it's very easy to do and the adjustments are very effective; just a matter of getting it where you like it.Our TV is in a pretty well lit living room.  Glare has not been a big factor, which is a relief for us.  Effective viewing angle has also been very good (one of our chairs is pretty much off to the side, but the picture is still very viewable from over there).We've found the sound is quite good.  It has rear-firing speakers, so not good for any kind of enclosed installation.  We have ours on the provided swivel stand and it's out from the wall about a foot or so which I think is probably ideal for this type of speaker setup.  Definitely not equal to a surround sound system, but quite acceptable for built-in speakers.Overall, we're very satisfied and found this TV to be a good value.

Reviews.Title: I love my TV
Reviews.Author: Nams
Reviews.Content: This TV is amazing. :) i just love it. I have friends who tell how superior my TV is when compared to theirs - Sony Bravia...

Reviews.Title: Great tv for the money!
Reviews.Author: Craig
Reviews.Content: I researched LCD televisions for quite some time, eventually settling on the Samsung LN46C630 46-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LCD HDTV (Black).  To date, I have zero complaints about the set.  I am using the television for my living room in small 1 bedroom apt, a room that is ~16x22'.  If I had to do it all over again, I definitely would get the same size television, no bigger.  The Samsung picture, especially for movies is incredibly lifelike.  Everyone who watches the television makes the same comment on how real the characters look.  Already, I have recommended the television to one friend.  The only technology missing from the television is internet connectivity, the difference in cost was not worth it for me, but for some people it may be.Overall, I don't think you can go wrong by purchasing this set.

Reviews.Title: Television of the Gods
Reviews.Author: K. Black
Reviews.Content: After years of standing around the showroom, staring at these amazing televisions, I finally bought one. I bought it through Amazon's Warehouse Deals as a Used - Good condition. I cannot find anything to suggest that it was "used", besides the price which was about $200 less than Amazon's. It was shipped through Pilot delivery service, which I had never heard of before but was just fine. I set up the delivery date on checkout and they came on time, with a call beforehand. The delivery guy even helped me get the TV into my living room.-PC:The first thing I did was connect my PC (9800GT video cards) to the TV, via a 1080p-capable DVI to HDMI cable. Last time I hooked up my PC to an HDTV, I had to manually resize the resolution because the image was cut off even though I had been using a 1920x1080 monitor (also made by Samsung). However, with this TV, there was an automatic resize option in the menu, and I only had to press one button. This was the first thing that impressed me about the user-friendliness of this TV. My computer looked amazing! My desktop wallpapers popped right out and came to life in full beautiful color.-Xbox 360:The next thing I attached was my Xbox 360, via the optional VGA cable, into the PC (VGA) input. The sound wasn't working immediately but that was my fault. The game (Red Dead Redemption) looked awesome too! However, I know there are some settings that need to be changed to make it look perfect, mostly on the Xbox itself. I'll update this review once I get the Xbox attached with an HDMI cable instead of VGA. It's mostly because of the refresh rate - this TV is 120Hz capable and I'm pretty sure the Xbox is only doing 60Hz. But with the image smoothing turned on, it was looking way better than on my 23" monitor.-USB:One of the main reasons why I purchased this TV is for the USB input. It was hard to find an accurate description of what this can do, exactly, so I will describe it. My first experiment with this was with a USB drive. I wanted to put a 1080p movie on it, but the flash drive was only 4GB so none would fit. Instead, I put an episode of BBC Life on it (720p Blu-Ray in .mkv format). Playing from the USB is really easy - it plugs into the side, and then you just change the input with the remote to "Media Drive" or something similar. Samsung sorts all the files by type - video, music and pictures. In the video folder, my show was right there, and I just pressed Play.It looked SO GOOD. I felt like I was in the showroom again. It was so completely amazing that I felt like I didn't deserve this TV, because you can't enjoy something with such a powerful materialistic lust without being an evil person. Well if this is wrong I don't want to be right. The color is crisp and beautiful (hello, 120,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio), so bright and lovely that the plants and animals of BBC Life were almost *too* real. I think that I could travel around the whole world and not see things as beautiful as they appear on this TV. And it was only in 720p! I'll update my review once my large USB drive gets here and I can try a 1080p video. I think USB is the best way to watch media on this TV, as you don't need to buy any expensive DVD players or configure any options. I could watch things right from my computer with HDMI, but you can't output from the PC in 120Hz. Plus they are re-writable and can store any type of media.As far as the sound goes, it's pretty much as good as you can expect for built in speakers. It's "surround sound" but I didn't really feel surrounded like I do with 5.1 speakers. However, the bass is exceptional for not having a sub-woofer. Once I get my surround sound speakers wall-mounted I will probably use those instead.I'm sold on Samsung products. You really can't find better quality. My phone, monitor, and 2TB hard drive are all made by Samsung and now my TV is too. They are the best. Compare them side-by-side and it's plain to see how much better Samsung is than Sony, LG, Sharp, and all those other brands. This TV is very user-friendly, with easy configuration of settings. The remote is good too - functional. Some TVs have flimsy stands but this one seems very sturdy. I read complaints about difficulty putting the stand on, but mine came already on so I can't say anything about that.Anyway, these are the only things I've tried with this TV so far. I'm going to try connection over CAT5 cable, as well as attaching an external hard drive via USB. I'll update this when I do.The only thing I'm worried about is the energy cost of running it, even though I'm not using it 24/7 or as my main computer display. It's Energy-Star certified but who knows what that means. They say these TVs crap out in 2 years... well I bought the 4 year SquareTrade warranty so hopefully it's never an issue!

Reviews.Title: Very good product, nothing to complain
Reviews.Author: Sumin Song
Reviews.Content: We already have one Samsung lcd tv 40' (forget the model, might be LN40B550 something) and we like it. As family grows we need another lcd tv, which is slightly bigger but not too big due to room size. This time when we got started we tried to avoid Samsung since personally we are the kind of people who like trying different models/manufacturers and hate sticking to one particular one. We shopped around in Amazon, and even walked in local BestBuy for other lcds like Toshiba, Panasonic, Sharp, Sony, etc. We were kind of disappointed there are just NOT any other model that is close to Samsung lcd tv in term of the ratio of quality/price.After about 2~3 weeks we finally gave up and bought this one LN46C630. Since we have experience with Samsung we don't expect any surprise. But surprise really comes! This model has much clearer resolution than the other one (LN40B550) and even from the kitchen I can see clearly the captions near the bottom of the screen. We guess that might be due to the big size of screen, but I am not convinced 6' difference can make it so clear. Also the sound is much better too. We have the new tv for about 3 weeks now, everything works perfectly so far.Remember though you need a little bit time to install the stand and tighten the tv, normally within 10 minutes. I am a short guy and my wife is pregnant but we had no any problem getting it set up smoothly in about 8 minutes. The only downside is that the delivery service company Amazon contracts has no weekend delivery option, but anyway you can always schedule it on Friday later afternoon right ...

Reviews.Title: Great TV.
Reviews.Author: Scott Beckinsale
Reviews.Content: Great TV of modern age.  Would recommend this TV to my friends.  Bought it for a month and no complaint so far. Colors are vivid and sound quality is good. skykomish, I am not who you're looking for. Scott.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Jonas Rees
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV after doing a little online research. I was a little skeptical at first for ordering such a large item over the internet. The TV was supposed to be delivered on the 22nd of April. After a lot of excuses from Pilot (the shipping carrier) I finally received the TV on the 24th. The guy that delivered it drove it to my house in a minivan and was very helpful with setting it up on the stand. I was concerned because it had been moved around so  much before I had turned it on. Once the set was on the picture out of the box was great. Avatar on Blu-Ray looked better on this set then it did in 3d in the theater. With Hi Def cable hooked up to it most shows look like your actually on the set and it takes a little getting used to. I also tried the X-box 360 with HDMI and the picture was very crisp and motion was clear. I thought the remote was responsive and the set immediately detected my cable remote allowing TV function with the cable remote with no programming needed. I used 4 hdmis immediately to this set and they all look great. Picture is very clear even in a bright room and set doesn't get much glare. Overall a great product at a competetive price.

Reviews.Title: Great picture when it works....Updated Review
Reviews.Author: Politicking
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV about two weeks ago and after 2 hours of use it just turned off. I have checked the power supply and settings, they are fine. After calling Samsung, they decided to send out a service tech. I have to wait another week for the parts to come in and maybe get the TV working thereafter. I've owned the TV since April 6, 2010 and have not been able to enjoy it for more than 30 minutes. The specific problems are listed below:TV turning off and on 2-3 times and staying offTV going black with small amount of light shinning throughRemote completely unresponsive after changing batteriesScreen blurring at top when it does turn onRecommendation: the (C) series is brand new, I would wait a few months until they have the bugs worked out. It is very frustrating having a brand new beautiful TV and it not working. As I indicated earlier, when it does work for a brief period, the picture is absolutely amazing on blu-ray (via PS3) and HD cable.Samsung's customer service has been very pleasant and responsive thus far. Will follow-up after repairs.**Addition:After having the TV replaced, the set works perfect. Its been a few months now. The picture is beautiful and even standard DVD looks amazing. I still have some "clouding" in the bottom corners (small white patches) and a audio syncing issue. The audio is a fraction of a second delayed behind the picture. I've tried a few fixes and nothing has worked yet. Other than that I am very pleased with the TV and the quality. It is a great TV for the price. Nothing I've looked at comes close. My next purchase will be a 240 HZ set. The 120 HZ has to work very hard to keep up with fast moving scenes.

Reviews.Title: Best Value Out There
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Andolaro "ralphiere"
Reviews.Content: For the money, you can't really top this TV.  Most signals from Cable, FIOS, etc are less than this TV can display so don't waste your money on the latest and greatest unless you want to watch BlueRay discs with surround sound in a media room.  This TV is perfect for everyday normal TV watching and is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Super TV - My new hero!!!
Reviews.Author: C. M. K. "C K"
Reviews.Content: Ok, so for my first HDTV I went crazy researching each and every detail I felt was important to me in a television. I had initially bought a plasma TV at a brick and mortar store only to return it a week later because of it's loud buzzing sound that seems to be an epidemic among plasma's. But I had bought that plasma because I wanted deep black levels and a fast refresh rate. So after hours of research, I had narrowed my selection down to a few models (mostly Samsung, but a couple others too.) This TV - the LN46C630 - was my top choice. It had excellent black levels for a LCD, and it's anti-judder and refresh rate were highly recommended by two trusted online sources (I don't know if it's appropriate to mention them here). The TV did not disappoint!!! The picture on this set is BETTER than the plasma I had just returned and the features and ease of use are outstanding - absolutely outstanding! I have yet to see any evidence of judder or problems with refresh rates and after hours of purposely searching for anything I could complain about, I've come up empty. I love it. My 9-year-old son loves it. My new girlfriend likes it more than she likes me! Actually, I'm pretty sure she just comes over to watch the TV :) LOL. Seriously though, I couldn't be happier and that says something because I am quite hard to please. The sound on this thing is fantastic - I have to admit I'm a bit reluctant to turn it up all the way, but it sounds great at louder than reasonable levels, although a little bit deeper base would be appreciated. Still, it's not a stereo - it's a TV and it sounds better than any stereo I've had before. The XBOX 360 looks better than real life and this HD nature sunrise show I watch every morning makes me forget I'm living in an urban apartment because I'm mentally transported to the scene. Sure, most HDTVs can do this, but to this degree?Another note ... I bought this through Amazon's Warehouse deals and found practically nothing wrong whatsoever. It had stated that small scratches were located on the bezel and back of the unit, but I found none. It was packaged as if it was brand new. It contained everything the manual said it should and with the exception of a couple model numbers being handwritten on the back of the manual, it was in perfect condition. The delivery guys were professional and allowed me to open it up and inspect it before i signed for it. I set it up quickly and have been happy ever since. Now if I could just get that hot new girlfriend to look at me the way she looks at my TV ... I guess I don't mind being used for my electronics ;) Have fun with your new set! Chris

Reviews.Title: Not a bad LCD
Reviews.Author: quiksilver723
Reviews.Content: I should mention first that this is my first ever flat panel TV and the largest TV I've ever owned.  And I have done research on the different types of TVs for a while so I thought I knew what I wanted.  And I like this TV overall but there are some quirks that unfortunately come with LCD's.  One is the viewing angle, while the picture never becomes unwatchable it does become washed out the more off center you view the TV.  Now if you never watch TV off center then you're probably ok but for me I watch it from different angles and I can notice the change in picture quality.  The other issue which is a little more of an annoyance for me is the motion blur that again comes from the fact that it's an LCD.  All my friends own LCDs and I've never heard them complain about it even though I knew it to exist with these kinds of TVs so I thought I wouldn't be disappointed.  Well...it does bug me from time to time now.  When the picture is standing still then it's crisp and vibrant, but as soon as the camera pans or someone runs across the screen it blurs.  I'm trying to just accept it and move on, which I have for the most part.  But it does make me wish I had tried a plasma instead.  I also wonder if getting a smaller screen like the 40" would've decreased the blur issue.  I watch HD television, blu-ray movies and play xbox on this TV and the games can be the worse to notice the blurring so I wouldn't recommend this TV for games.  IF you choose to play games on it anyways then you need to use the "game mode" because that cuts out lag you will notice in the regular mode.  Also be prepared to have you TV calibrated by a professional or you can do what I did and buy a colorimeter for $150 and be able to do all your inputs and be able to do any future TV.  The colors our of the box just seem too blue and self calibration isn't too hard especially with the free guides out there on the internet.  So that's my two cents, it's a good TV but not a great TV so hopefully this will help you with your decision.

Reviews.Title: Great  TV. Remote could use a little improvement
Reviews.Author: john doe
Reviews.Content: I am by no means a big video/audio buff. Movies and ps3 looks great and oh so clear. I bought it at 940 and thought its great price considering the 46B630 is over 1K. The only thing I don't like about the product is the remote. It can be a little unresponsive at times but not enough to be a bother.Delivery by Ceva was excellent. Unpack the unit and plug it in for me to test. Great service all around

Reviews.Title: only lasted 2 years...
Reviews.Author: Penndragon
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV in 2010.  Loved it!  Unfortunately, 2 years later there is a red haze that takes over the screen and has gotten worse and worse.  Sometimes there is visible black lines across the entire screen as well...  We now have to replace the TV.I don't know if this is a common experience, but I would say look for a different model...

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I advise you to avoid this television and most of Samsung's televisions for a matter of fact.  The television had a great picture when it worked but as time progressed the tv would take longer and longer to turn on.  Sometimes taking about 30 seconds to finally display a picture.  Now the tv will not turn on at all, of course, only a few months after warranty had expired.  The issue has been traced to bad capacitors in their power supplies in ALL of their televisions up until at least 2011.  There have been class action lawsuits for the LN T models but unfortunately they are not providing free out of warranty service for this model even though it is the exact same issue.  Here is more information on the class action suit: [...]Google "samsung tv won't turn on" or "Samsung tv flicker" and you'll get plenty of hits.  Avoid Samsung televisions!

Reviews.Title: Great until it wasn't
Reviews.Author: John Koehn
Reviews.Content: This TV was amazing for the first 18 months until the screen suddenly became fuzzy and distorted.  It comes and goes, with increasing frequency.  Samsung says it's not in warranty anymore, conveniently.  Buying a Sony next - TVs should last longer than 18 months.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: MP "MP"
Reviews.Content: Looked OK at first, but started flickering after 16 months.  Just out of warranty window.  Probably bad back-light.  What a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Good for a year then there is a serious flickering bug.  GET AN EXTENDED WARRANTY!
Reviews.Author: Piranhamae
Reviews.Content: This television is terrific.  You get great picture for the price but you MUST BUY THE EXTENDED WARRANTY because right around the year mark the tv starts flickering and Samsung hasn't been the best about admitting this defect at all.There are many forums posted with people who did not get the warranty and samsung denying the problem.I did happen to buy the warranty (which i tend to do with anything i buy from Fry's cause you get what you pay for)  but spent months doing the rigamarole  of changing out the HDMI cables,  calling my internet company,  calling my Playstation reps,  messing with the eco solution settings, video settings, backlight settings.  all of these things would stop the flickering temporarily but now it happens SOOOOO often i had to call in my warrantee.According to the posts it is a faulty power supply board.  I notice other Samsung monitors and tv's have the same problem that is solved with switching out the color wheel.Know this going in and you'll be fine.  It's still worth the $  it's a reasonable price even with the extra warrantee.  I gave it 3 stars for the hassle of having to call a technician in and the drama around this issue.  But the quality of the TV is superb when it's working properly and I hope to keep it for a long time.Luckily, I still have another year and a half on my xtended warrantee! :)

Reviews.Title: Good  TV but only for 15 months
Reviews.Author: YK-reviewer "YK-reviewer"
Reviews.Content: TV has design defect reported by dozens of people. All complain about same problem: 13-18 months after purchasing the picture starts flickering. They also report that the problem is in the TV power supply and is common to all sizes of series 610, 630 and 650. Samsung does not assume responsibility for this design defect and will charge you for fixing it, so you end up with a refurbished TV when you pay for refurbishing. So if you want a TV that will work for more than a year and a half, buy a more reliable/ responsible brand like Sony or Panasonic. Note that some of the other TVs might use Samsung displays, which are not bad, but they make their own circuit design that seems much more reliable.Samsung has a live chat support, but it seems they put it mainly to protect their image, not service the customers. Their response is to upgrade your TV software" (easy to do, did it and it is of course useless for this hardware problem) and then they give you a service link which you have to pay for. Oh, and they say "I'm very sorry to hear that you have a problem..."

Reviews.Title: Super great deal!!!
Reviews.Author: salasrasta416
Reviews.Content: I have this hooked up in HD and have to say it's night and day compared to my old tube TV. I got this for a screamin deal on here. Compared to 6 other places I looked it had them beat by a couple hundred bucks and in one case even $800. Also great payment plan.

Reviews.Title: Overall we're happy with this tv
Reviews.Author: doubleganger
Reviews.Content: We're pretty happy with this tv.  I just want to mention a couple of things.  First, what appears to be a headphone connector on the back is really a line out, which means that you can't control the volume from the tv.  We don't have a home theater sound system but I did have a pretty nice computer sound system that I wasn't using that would have worked if the audio outlet on the tv had volume control.  Second, and this is pretty nice, when we turn on our Panasonic blue ray player the tv turns itself on and automatically switches to the correct input.  I wish our satellite receiver had the same function.

Reviews.Title: Great TV.
Reviews.Author: James Douglas
Reviews.Content: This is my second big screen TV from Samsung. They make a great product and I am extremely happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46C630 - thumbs up!
Reviews.Author: Pk
Reviews.Content: After looking through CNET and other on-line reviews of 40-46" LCD displays, my research suggested that this Samsung had some of the more important features (120Hz / 1080p, number of HDMI ports) at a very competitive price.  I was VERY impressed with the picture quality, especially compared to my only other in-home HD TV, a 2 year old Panasonic Veira 50" Plasma.  Side by side, running Blu-Ray through a Sony Blu-Ray player, the image had more 'pop' and depth compared to the plasma.  Kids love playing PS3 games on it - picture quality is great and I like the ability to switch picture settings while seeing the results immediately on screen.  Sound quality of the TV speakers is good.  User remote is backlit (nice feature).  Set-up was fast and easy to follow the on-screen directions.  The only thing the 630 doesn't have that the 650 does is direct Internet access.  I get that through the Sony Blu-Ray and PS3 consoles so I'm not missing much - certainly not worth the $200 difference between the 630 and the 650.  Would definitely buy another one if I needed another 46" display.

Reviews.Title: perfect size, great picture
Reviews.Author: Becca Radamer
Reviews.Content: This is the first Samsung television we have owned and we have really enjoyed it. Great picture and it looked great mounted on the wall. Big enough to make sports, movies, and video games exciting. Great color. I am not a technical person, but when compared to the Visio that my parents own, or other low-end sets, I can tell a big difference. Not top of the line, but good enough for me!

Reviews.Title: Great Samsung HDTV
Reviews.Author: C. Zerull
Reviews.Content: The TV was actually delivered 4 days earlier than predicted.  We were notified very early about a delivery date & time.  Set for the TV was very easy.  I hooked up the Samsung Blu-Ray player with no difficulty.  Also I tested the TV inconjunction with my PC.  All is well.  We can view our photos and videos on the TV.  The sound is acceptable for us.  I have yet to use the Netflix button, but that should be as easy as all the rest of the features.  I would recommend this for friends & relatives.  The 46" is just the right size, and also the built in turn-table makes it easy to view, but cetainly is not necessary.  We get NO glare from the windows either.  We are pleasantly VERY satisfied with our purchase, and feel we got a super deal after spending less than $800.00 for it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung: Great picture quality, but problems with OTA reception
Reviews.Author: Larry Darnell "old movie buff"
Reviews.Content: First the positive: Set-up was a snap.  The picture quality was sweet, right out of the box.  BluRay disk playback was absolutely gorgeous; my wife and I were simply "wowed!"Now the negative and why it was returned:  Like a growing number of consumers (albeit a minority), my primary entertainment source is (streaming) Netflix along with OTA (antenna) programming - mostly for news and weather plus some network programming.On the day I received the set, it was rather stormy, so (antenna) signal strenths were challenged.  After the set-up was complete, including the initial channel scan, I began viewing my normal favorites.  Whenever the signal would grow weak, the set would become "disoriented" and unresponsive.  If I tried to go back to a PREViously strong channel, no dice, it would not lock-on.  The only solution was to cycle the set "off," then "on" again.  Once again, however, the same thing would occur - no recovery.  By comparison, my three-year-old Sony Bravia, under the same circumstances will recover without intervention.Thank goodness I purchased the set directly from Amazon and was able to return it without hastle and with a full refund.  Return shipping was "on their nickel."In conclusion, this phenomenon has been documented previously, on this thread, via. a review posted around Feb. 4th (I believe).  In addition a similar problem was reported on [...] regarding a different Samsung set.  If you are a cable or dish subscriber, this problem will not be an issue for you and I'm certain that you will be pleased with the performance of this set.BTW, I tried to contact Samsung by e-mail seeking a resolution with absolutely no response.  They did, however, put me on their "junk' e-mail list.  Actually, this was my real motive - I need more junk e-mail!

Reviews.Title: 1st mainstream LCD and you have yourself one happy camper!
Reviews.Author: Jesse "Shogun" McGuyver
Reviews.Content: I have now had my Samsung LCD 46" for roughly 3 weeks and still learning on it, but overall think I have it down pat. Picture is amazing on this set and I did a lot of comparing for weeks, maybe months. I wanted to go big intially (55" and up) but ended up sticking to my original pricing of under 1000 dollars, which kudos to me as that is hard for me to do, lo1! Back to the picture for a few. Out of the box by default they had the "torch" effect going on and wow it was way off IMO. I spent a good 20 minuets setting it up to my liking and feel I have it where I need it. I have a PS3 for my BR playing and wow does it ever look amazing! First movie I went out and rented (Dont buy no more...) was Dispeciable me and my god the clarity, the colors, the blacks.....just unreal!(My 15 month son kept jumping at screen to try and touch the minons.) Almost looks 3D without glasses on...most would say that is bad, not in my case. You do need to adjust some stuff with the auto motion as when set to smooth and some others it gives you that soap opera effect, which drives me nuts! I shut it off on movies and turn it on for live sports, seems to work pretty well. Also if you game a lot, you will love this TV! I have never been more in love with my PS3! Like a lost love I havent saw in a long time....and yes I started getting bored with my PS3 as my Westinghouse HD el cheapo (Actually paid more for this set 5 years ago! :() LCD wasnt doing me any justice. Trust me, you will love this TV for gaming...Love the design, classy looking, not to skinny or fat, just perfect! Bezel is a nice gloss black and of course catches every onece of dust and this set does through off some glare. Most I have saw on any LCD unit, but my apartment doesnt have a lot of light, so that is okay....be aware though if you have a big lit room or windows with a lot of sun coming through might need to weigh some options. Thats what they make blinds for though...and lights can be turned off or some even dimmed. Remote is nice seems a lot of people harp on the remote, I actually think it is pretty neat! Has that feature where you can link it to control PS3, DVD player and supposedly cable box, but cant seem to get it to work on cable box. Like I said, still learning.As far as sound goes I have a good HT setup consisting of JBL/Polk 5.1 suround sound and Onkyo Dolby digital 1000 watt receiver and 10" FI Q sub and honestly I am really impressed with the sound built into the TV. The speakers are on the back, so they reflect sound off the wall to give you the feel of surround sound and dont do a bad job considering. (I still use my 5.1 SS majority though...) but for people that dont want to spend more on a cheap or expensive SS setup, I believe most would be happy. I dont suggest wall mounting it though unless having a SS setup as I believe speakers wouldnt get ample space and may sound muffled.Only downside I have really noticed is I do sometimes get that light effect to where it dims then brightens again and no I am not talking about the ECO system to where it is supposed to do that. I have it shut off. Some reviews talk about bad capacitors going on these units and maybe it is just in my head, but I swear I notice it and only 3 weeks in. No worries as I bought this at Sam's Club and I have the one year manufracturing warraty and added Sam's 4 year to it for 79 smacks! So in good hands me thinks. Just the packing of it up and sending off....pain in whazoo!Overall, great experience thus far and so glad I finally decided on a better name brand than my Westinghouse. Night and day difference in picture and build quality, thus far...time tells all. My Westinghouse has lasted 5 years and still enjoy it as it is our bedroom TV now.Happy shopping friends, hope this helped someone. Also will revise if I run into any problems. :)

Reviews.Title: 46" Samsung LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Linda J. Jones
Reviews.Content: Best purchase we have made in a long time.  The quality of this Samsung TV is outstanding - easy to install, easy to operate.

Reviews.Title: Very good Tv for the price
Reviews.Author: VJ
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV about a month ago and its been pretty good so far. It has great clarity, good sound, easy to setup and use controls. If you are not a very picky hard core gadget freak then this TV is an easy pick.Some negatives (but minor in my opinion)1. The speaker are facing the rear and seem to throw sound backwards. I dont have an issue as I am not mounting it on the wall. But some one mounting on the wall might want to check on this before they purchase this.2. The remote is extremely unattractive and looks like a cheap plastic toy. But it has all the functionality so is not a show spoiler.I would recommend this TV to people considering something in this price range and type.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and look but has some issues
Reviews.Author: kristka
Reviews.Content: I love the TV. Looks great, quality is great. The only thing I seem to have issues with is the signal. It seems to not always work with it's remote or the univeral at times. This get's pretty frustrating, doubt all the TVs do it.

Reviews.Title: Love Samsung
Reviews.Author: L. Whister
Reviews.Content: Samsung seems to be the leader in flat screen tv's these days.  The black level is just as good as any Sony they had on display and I had no motion blur problewms. Not sure about 3D and if you're not into spending a lot of cash check out the . If your looking for a set for a small room then this is probably too big but in a larger room, this tv is amazing.It almost looks 3D for sports games.  The deph and clarity and robustness of the colors is astounding.  I am really glad to be living in this high tech era.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: Tyler Sutrisno
Reviews.Content: The HD looks so nice on this samsung tv that the football games almost look 3 dimensional.  The colors and depth perception are amazing. . If your looking for a set for your bedroom or your living room this is the perfect set. Deals are all over the place but the one that stands outand you still get free shipping! Total shipped price is very competitive ! I just can't get over how good this set is! Looking at the LN40C630 at my local store it was just amazing. I am a really big fan of qusar but this set is even better. The black level is just as good as any Sony I have seen and didnt have any motion delay issues.

Reviews.Title: Best Value for 46 Inch Class
Reviews.Author: JDKMEDIA
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for two reasons: Consumer Reports recommended it and it had really high owner reviews.  The quality is excellent.  Favorite features are aesthetics and the usb ports on the side.  It has all the ports you need to plug in a host of devices.  You'll have to spend some time getting the picture dialed in for certain films, as the quality of the picture is almost too good!  (You might have to "dumb-down" the advanced motion stuff.  )Best TV in this class.  Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: P. Chui "semper promptus"
Reviews.Content: I used to buy 90% Sony electronic equipment, until I bought a Samsung TV 3 years ago.  As I researched a new 47 inch for my study, my choice came down to Sony or Samsung.  Samsung has similar features and a lower price point.  Since I had excellent experience with my firsts Samsung TV (55"), I bought another one.Setup was easy.  The toughest was setting up the stand! Programming and hookups are straight-forward.  With LAN, it syncs up to my computer automatically and now I can view my computer photos and listen to my music files.The only downside is the remote, which is not a universal multi-device remote.  Otherwise, everything is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Definitely Worth It
Reviews.Author: John Doe
Reviews.Content: Disclosure: This is my first HD TV.Summary: Worth the money, buy it!So I finally made the switch to HD and after hours of reviewing information online, I settled for this TV. Overall I'm really happy with it except for a few minor points:- Remote: The remote doesn't work with my LG Blu-Ray player. I don't know why manufacturers insist on making their own proprietary format for remote controls codes, but none the less it is a short coming- Lack of wireless connectivity: Although this TV does support ethernet, it requires an additional $60 adapter if you want it to connect wirelessly to the network. It is a shortcoming so make sure you are able to run a wire to the TV if you want to access networked content- Update documentation: I tried to upgrade the firmware on this TV box and the documentation was nearly non-existent. Also it only works from a Windows based box, sorry for you Mac/Linux lovers out there!Overall though, I am extremely happy about everything else with this TV. The delivery guys even unboxed/set it up for my GF while I was away at work.

Reviews.Title: Great TV - Poor Shipping
Reviews.Author: timmer
Reviews.Content: Shipping and white glove "free ship" was non-exsistent. Had to track down package at shipper CEVA who was 2 days over delivery with no contact. They offered to drop tv at the house but I needed to help since their was only 1 person to deliver. No setup was to be offered. Beware of shipping if you select free option. The estimated dates changed as the order was processed from 1 to 2 weeks. Not sure the 100 dollars I saved was worth it. All my Amazon experiences in general have been excellant but selection of the 3rd party shipper is questionable and should be reviewed.The TV is great. The Allshare feature works with my att captivate /galaxy s phone also. Sound is not the best but optical out to a good amp fixs that.The LNC model doesn't seem to have the capacitor problem of the a,b models.Recommend this TV highly.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Good Price
Reviews.Author: ChadTrh
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV 8 months ago and have absolutely loved it every day since.  The picture quality is outstanding! When we have company we are constantly getting compliments on how real the picture looks. The bezel is sleek and stylish, an elegant looking TV, especially compared to the competition. We paid a little more for this TV, as we were originally looking at a Vizio and a lower model Samsung, but after (a lot) of research we settled on this one--and I'm glad we did.So our model has the "red" accented bezel, supposedly it has a red tint around the edge of the bezel, however, we cannot see this at all. (In our case, this is a huge pro) but if you're looking for a TV that's going to glow the wall behind it red, don't expect it to. It's not noticeable at all to us, but while shopping we were concerned about it.One of the only cons we came across after purchasing the TV is that the 120 hertz is unavailable on our cable provider and we can only use it with the blu ray player, but this isn't Samsung's fault. But something worth mentioning.I'd recommend, and have recommended this TV to absolutely anyone who has eyes.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV, great price.
Reviews.Author: J. Spelkoman
Reviews.Content: For under a grand, you will get an amazing, beautiful picture on a very large screen. What you wont get are the bells and whistles like apps and built in netflix. but if you have or are planning to buy a blu-ray player or ps3 (or xbox i guess) then you'll be totally fine and have no need to fork over hundreds extra. I wish sometimes is would automatically switch back to cable when i shut my ps3 or wii off, but that's really just me being lazy. Oh, and shut the 120hz off for anything other than sports. movies look bizarre and out of sync with it on.The picture is equal to any fancy LED backlit TV, and is less than half the price. This one is the smart buy.

Reviews.Title: Good Purchase
Reviews.Author: Erica
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is beautiful. The shipping was so fast. The only thing that I don't like is the sound quality, its not very good. It's loud enough but it's really weird sounding. I was watching School of Rock and the when theres a scene with music it's really muted in the backround. I was waiting to see for myself how the sound is before I purchased a separate sound sysem. I bought one the day after the Television was set up. I guess thats typical for flatscreens though. It's a good buy

Reviews.Title: A great TV
Reviews.Author: Marc Twain
Reviews.Content: The picture is amazing and it was easy to set up. I looked at this tv at an electronics store and it was the best picture, with the exception of the LCD/LED, but I didn't want to spend that kind of money. I read that some of the Samsung's have a buzzing sound, but this tv is silent. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied with purchase of Samsung Televison
Reviews.Author: Susanne E. Hoffman
Reviews.Content: First of all we were very happy with the prompt and early delivery of the televsion.  We had been unable to purchase at a local electronics store as they were "out of stock".  I checked Amazon on Easter Sunday, they had better pricing and immediate delivery.  Quality of picture is great and we are very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy!
Reviews.Author: David Hickok
Reviews.Content: Having spent the last 10 years watching a 26" Sony WEGA CRT, I was looking forward to an HD set and definitely larger screen.  I purchased a Samsung 19" LCD a few years ago and have been very happy with its performance, the remote, etc. I'd been looking at the Samsung LN46B 500- and 600-series.  I was prepared to pull the trigger on the LN46B530 when the "C" series came out and was priced fairly competitively.I went with the LN46C630 along with the Sony HTCT100 sound bar since I'd read some of the concerns with sound quality.  I have the say both the TV and sound bar are awesome.  The only issue I've had is with interference with iR remotes and the power saving stuff on the TV.  Unless I have the TV's brightness set to normal and the energy conservation stuff off, my remotes barely function and when they do, often send the wrong signal.  Apparently a known issue with LCD televisions so it's not a fault with Samsung or this TV.Overall a great TV and VERY happy with the matte screen.  Not sure why Samsung's website doesn't explicitely state which are glossy and which are matte.

Reviews.Title: Great picture with some user interface annoyances
Reviews.Author: Zerkfitting
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is great. But I'm annoyed with a couple user interface designs.Selecting an InputMy other TV has an input button where each time you press the button it cycles through any inputs that are connected. The Samsung input button displays a menu and you have to navigate with the arrow buttons then select an input, it takes 4-6 button presses to change inputs (there are over a dozen inputs listed - fortunately the ones you use are near the top).Input DisplayI'm not sure when this displays but it seems like every time I change channels the TV displays information in the upper left corner for about 3-4 seconds. It displays the input (such as HDMI2), the input name, and the resolution of the input. I don't know how to turn it off.AnynetI don't know if it works with just Sumsung devices or all devices. I have a Samsung blueray player and when you turn it on the TV automatically switches to it. At first I thought this was a cool feature. But I don't always want to switch to the player when I turn it on, sometimes I like to let a disc run through the numerous previews before I want to watch so you have to go through the selecting an input process and if you are a little slow it switches back to the player and you have to start over. When you are done and turn the player off the TV doesn't go back to the last input - you have to go through the input selection process. At least you can turn the feature off if you don't like it.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV; GREAT PICTURE
Reviews.Author: MIKEB
Reviews.Content: We looked around for quite awhile before deciding to perchase a samsung.  This TV is better than we could have hoped.  It is so clear and vivid.  The options for display are incredible.  They have tons of options for sound and picture.  1080p was well worth the price.  We got 120 Hz and I can see a big difference especially when watching live HD sporting events.  movies are great as well.Very pleased with the delivery and price on Amazon.  The TV is lighter than it looks and fit well into a standard mounting bracket, which I would recommend.  There is little to no glare on the screen, so watching in the daytime is just as good as night.  Overall, very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: J2P2
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV.I finally had enough of watching movies and playing games on a small, antique TV. I decided that I wanted to upgrade to a nice HDTV but I didn't want to spend the big bucks while doing it. I put in about 4 weeks of research going through different models and makes of TVs and I landed quite nicely on this Samsung beauty. The picture quality is amazing. Even watching DVDs on this TV look great. When I popped in Avatar on Blu-ray... Fantastic. The sound quality is pretty good, nothing to brag about. The only thing I didn't fully enjoy at first was the remote, it's a little sensitive and laggy. I find myself pressing the on button multiple times before the TV turns on, but once it's powered up its much more responsive. Changing default settings were very easy because the display menus are very well organized. I would definitely recommend this TV to a friend or family member. The shipping worked like a dream as well.

Reviews.Title: Extremely clear picture quality.  Have to aim Remote
Reviews.Author: BKI "CALI TV"
Reviews.Content: Great T.V. picture quality! HD and SD picture are both very clear.  Can even see facial wrinkles on HD programs.One issue,  T.V Remote,  had to have Samsung send a new one because one button did not work correctly.  Also remote must be pointed directly at T.V. to work.

Reviews.Title: Definitely Satisfied With My First HDTV Experience
Reviews.Author: R. Anderson
Reviews.Content: This was my first expierence with high definition television. I did quite a bit of research before deciding to go with Samsung.  I would have to say that I made the right decision. My television room is not very large so I maxed out with the 46 inch screen.  It is like being in a theater. The picture quality is exceptional and I love the matte finish on the screen. My room has a lot of windows and this definitely cuts down on the glare off of the television. Sound quality of the television is generic but satisfactory. I connected a small HTIB also from Samsung for movies and sports and so television speaker sound was not primary to me. The remote is average compared to others I saw when shopping for a television but I am using a Logitech remote for everything so that did not concern me either. I was cautious about making such a large purchase over the net but Amazon was great and the delivery through CEVA was terrific. Delivery was right on schedule and they unboxed and set up the TV for me. Couldn't ask for more with free delivery. Amazon price was anywhere from $100 to $400 below any in store price. Definitely would recommend this set.

Reviews.Title: amazing quality
Reviews.Author: Dark "dark n1ghtmar3"
Reviews.Content: I must start by saying i absolutely love this tv the picture quality is top-notch the 120hz runs smoothly it has a lot of great features i like how u can upgrade firmware using LAN port this tv is on there website but has a lot of errors in the specifications it says it has all the b model which is wrong says it don't have dlna (which it does) and has infolink which it doesn't there isnt a infolink button on remote. im very happy with this tv great black levels and whites I did have trouble with there pc manager program that works with allshare seems to be a network issuethe sound it pretty decent when u mess with tsome of the settings its sounds fantastic it says it has ToC which i cant even notive lots of great inputsi only watched some hi def cable stations and it looks amazing i have my computer on it looks great and my ps3 which i haven't checked out will do a blu-ray movie and update feedback get this tv you will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: Do not buy a samsung without reading this and doing a google search - on off issue very common
Reviews.Author: PaulJ7272
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to read this entire review you can skip it and just do a fast google and youtube search - samsung capacitor problem and samsung capacitor class action lawsuit. These are GREAT TVs while they work but they seem to only work for a year or two..... I was about to buy numerous more Samsung TVs (for a new home) but upon learning of this issue I absolutely will not and I cannot understand why anyone else would.This review is not about this specific TV - I want to be very clear upfront. However it is about a Samsung tv I purchased in June 2008 for $2,500. At the time that was what LN52A650 was priced. Today May 12, 2011 the TV started to experience a very common problem which many (if not all) Samsung TVs are experiencing no matter what model - the unit would click on and off rapidly and there was no way to stop it but to unplug it. Last night my tv was fine and this am it would just click on and off rapidly - so the tv is totally useless.Luckily and unusually for me, I happened to have purchased a 5 year extended warranty when I purchased the unit so I wasn't too upset - I am lucky my unit will be fixed for free but if I didn't purchase that warranty (which is usually a huge waste of money) I would be stuck with a repair bill between $200 and $500 (assuming I didn't want to try and fix it myself). The good news seems to be that the issue can be repaired and if you do it yourself it will cost under $40, but you have to risk messing up your tv. For TVs that now cost $1,500 (55"-52") no one should have to worry about the unit breaking in a year or two and then having to do a self repair versus paying a few hundred dollars.The reason I am writing this review is because I was about to purchase LN46C630 to view until my unit was fixed, and in addition because I need to purchase about 4 new tvs for a recent new home. I was actually EXCITED about purchasing Samsung units - well until today at least. Since I would be purchasing TVs in the next few months I figured why stress about the repair - I could get the 46" set and use it until the repair is completed. This morning I had no idea the defect was so common and felt my TV would be out of business for a month or so - now that I know the issue is common I hope that won't be the case. Even though I absolutely love the picture quality of this TV I can in no way purchase another Samsung knowing they have this issue and it appears Samsung knows their TVs have this problem.If anyone can recommend a TV with picture quality like the Samsung I would appreciate it - I am really bummed I cannot buy Samsung anymore but why would someone want to hassle with this issue in a year or two? Especially when Samsung knows about it.

Reviews.Title: What just happened?
Reviews.Author: Jason31
Reviews.Content: I received it within the two days and the package looked good. I was excited to set it up and start using it. I turned it on and was happy with the clarity. I flipped through a couple channels just to see the quality and was happy. I then decided to play xbox on it to see some graphics. Not even 20 minutes after the setup and turning it on the screen cut out on me and there was no picture. The audio is there but no picture. It is still covered by warranty and now I'm waiting for the private company to to come out and repair it for me. After repair and it goes bad on me I WILL be returning it to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46C630 Review
Reviews.Author: rdudgeon
Reviews.Content: From what I've seen, Samsung typically has some of the best picture quality and best black contrast on the market, but the TV I bought on Amazon had terrible picture quality and the dark colors were grainy.  It was completely unacceptable for an HDTV bought in 2010.  I don't know if it was a result of the long distance shipping or if it was an issue with where Amazon got the TV, but since I opened the box, Amazon wasn't going to refund it.  I'm going to have to go through Samsung to have this resolved.

Reviews.Title: If it breaks, expect terrible service!  Don't buy Samsung TVs
Reviews.Author: Andrew J. Rosen "RdBchAndy"
Reviews.Content: It's a nice TV but if it breaks, you have problems.  They are very nice on the phone, and will assign you to a local warranty service company.  The service company is unlisted and doesn't list its number on the service ticket (Lakes Electronics in Atlanta).  They never called to schedule, and I finally got their number from Samsung.  They scheduled me for 10 days out to repair my brand new TV.  I called to complain about the service to Samsung, and a very nice (but not surprised sounding) but said there was nothing they could do about it.  I got a supervisor who similarly indicated there was nothing they could do about scheduling time.  Disappointing and very bad service.  I wish I could return it, and certainly won't be buying any Samsung products in the future.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: houtex73
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV 3 months ago, and have been very happy with it.  Loved the white glove delivery service.  I constantly get compliments from guests about the picture clarity -- it is exceptional.  Mine is in a large room, and the sound just didn't carry well, so I now use a home theater system.  My only complaint is that when using a 3rd party remote to change the input, the TV's input menu stays on the screen way too long.  Other than that, I'm totally satisfied and highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Sophia Weeks
Reviews.Content: This tv is the Bomb!  The picture quality is great!  I love it. It's not a smart tv with all the extras. But we weren't looking for that. Just a good picture and this model is that. One thing is the volume button you have to keep pushing on the remote volume button to turn it up or down. But other than that. It's a great tv. I highly recommend it to anyone who just wants a good quality picture.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY SAMSUNG TV'S - they are junk that do not last.
Reviews.Author: Rob in Denver
Reviews.Content: I own the LN46A630, which is the "red" version of this TV.  My TV lasted 4 years.  I paid a premium for the Samsung name and got a junk TV that only lasted 4 years.  Samsung TV's are so bad, people are SELLING CAPACITOR REPAIR KITS because Samsung uses inferior components on its TV's.  Samsung makes junk TV's - mine cycles on and off endlessly.  I now have to buy a "SAMSUNG IS SUCH JUNK" fix it yourself repair kit on my $1,500 (what i paid) tv.  Unreal. I'll never buy a Samsung product again.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful,clear picture
Reviews.Author: Sunrise
Reviews.Content: The picture is very clear, and the colors are beautiful, and true to life.  The remote gives multiple options, which are very useful.The only negative is that once in awhile, the color kind-of clicks into an unusual greenish dominant background for a few minutes, then all of a sudden clicks back to beautiful color.This doesn't happen often, or I'd have a repair man check it out.  Maybe twice a month, this unusual switching of color occurs.

Reviews.Title: Great sound
Reviews.Author: J. Arntz
Reviews.Content: Great picture and sound; no need for a sound bar or remote speakers.  Extra HDMI connections accommodates my blu-ray player, a PC and a tablet.

Reviews.Title: Won't last long
Reviews.Author: James Yoo
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for a couple of years now and already the TV screen started to flicker. It's impossible to watch now since it'll give you a headache.  It's like looking into a strobe light.

Reviews.Title: Quality television, about 3 years since purchase..
Reviews.Author: drx10
Reviews.Content: Been a little over 3 years since buying this TV for my studio apartment, just getting to writing the review now. It's been a great TV and I will be the first to admit that I abuse my electronics quite a bit.  The TV is used on avg 8+ hours daily (longer on weekends) as I usually leave my TV on if I am at home.  It's got good picture quality, good sound quality (several options for whatever you are wanting to watch), plenty of HDMI ports.However, I stopped short of 5 stars as it has shown some flickering/shaky picture qualities on occasion.  I first suspected my cable company as they have been consistently sub-par, however, I recall the first time it occurred, resetting the cable box did not get rid of the flickering.  I then ended up turning the TV off and then back and it seemed to stop the flickering.  It hasn't happened often enough to make this a horrible TV, but to me, it was enough to knock it down a star as a 5-star quality would indicate close to flawless.Overall, I would recommend this TV and have enjoyed my purchase thus far.  I am highly likely to purchase another Samsung as my next (or bigger) flat screen TV.

Reviews.Title: TV less that 3 yrs old loud pop and no picture
Reviews.Author: Joan "j.qunn"
Reviews.Content: I was happy with this TV until it made a loud popping noise and smoke came out of it.  I lost the picture but I had sound.  I called Samsung and they told me to plug it in again and the same thing louder pop and more smoke.  They said it might be a "special case" and someone would call. They asked if it had set a fire or damaged any property when I said no they told me to call for repair and gave me a number for a local repairman.  They refused to pay for the repair. Do not buy any Samsung until you do a search on LCD/Plasma TV's dying after a year or two.

Reviews.Title: Samsung makes a great TV
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Jayjock
Reviews.Content: Got this in Oct of 2010 and we still love it.  It is our primary TV and has done everything we has asked of it.

Reviews.Title: Only lasted 3 years
Reviews.Author: Maggie Taylor
Reviews.Content: Initially this TV was great. However, when it was aabout a year and a half old, the screen started sending error messages, then it would go fuzzy, now it just turned black. The frustrating part is Samsung does not make it easy to get the TV repaired.  They offer very poor repair service.  The repair company they recommend is hard to get on the phone. Would not buy another Samsung TV for this reason.  I would expect the TV to work properly for a much longer period of time and it should not be so difficult to get repaired.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this samsung flat screen television LN46C630
Reviews.Author: Dorothy E. Bulgin
Reviews.Content: Two years after purchasing this television, the picture is flickering continuously. At first I thought it must be coming from the cable company only to discover that it was the television. For that price as well as consumer report recommendation, I imagined that I would get at least 5  years of care free service. I contacted Samsung and was told it is out of warranty so they cannot do anything. The technician Samsung referred want $109.00 dollars just to come through the door with an added charge for woking on the television itself. I currently have a JVC, still working after 12 years and cost a quarter of the price of this Samsung television. I definitely would not recommended this Samsung television or any other of their products to anyone. I am very disappointed in the this television performance.

Reviews.Title: worked good for three years then speakers took a crap, picture dimming
Reviews.Author: CarolM
Reviews.Content: I had good use from this tv for 3 years, and even bought a 2-yr extended warranty. well, now that warranty has expired, the tv is having problems, as luck would have it. about a month ago I started noticing static noise coming from the speakers and it keeps getting worse. it sounds like the sharp static you'd hear from a record player! and to make matters worse, the picture quality isn't near as bright and colorful as it was when I bought it. this thing should last more than 3 years with average use. i expected more from samsung.

Reviews.Title: Good picture, great functionality, bad longevity
Reviews.Author: Jake E.
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I've got two Samsung TV's. Both 46", both bought via Amazon. The first TV was bought 5 years ago and based on its flawless record, I bought another, newer model. I've now owned this newer LN46C630 model for 2 years and have had an issue each year. The first was a display issue that popped up after a year. The display just started flashing or going blank. After calling Samsung, a service appointment fixed the problem by replacing a board but not without paying $300 dollars. Samsung was unwilling to pay for the repair after just a year, largely because it was 4 months out of warranty. Last week, the TV started cycling on & off after about an hour of use. After doing my research on the issue, I found that the power cycle is apparently a known issue with Samsung TV's so I once again called Samsung and was told that more than likely I need to replace the inverter board which controls the power. I asked for a service discount based on the second hardware problem with the same TV but was told that because the service calls are managed independently, there is nothing they can do. I get the distinct sense that Samsung doesn't stand behind their quality product for very long.  Unfortunately, it just so happens that the nearest official Samsung repair center is 2 hours away so I end up paying for their service drive plus repair.Long story short, the Samsung TV's are a mixed bag. I haven't had any problem with my Series 6 LN46A650 but the LN46C630 is a consistent repair headache.

Reviews.Title: Lasted only 2 1/2 years
Reviews.Author: AngieG "Tanchaddy"
Reviews.Content: We bought this in October 2010. Worked great until yesterday. The tv powered off and won't power back on. I called Samsung and they said it's only under warranty for 1 year from date of purchase. My solution? Have a Samsung certified repair person call me with an estimated repair price (4 days from now) and I'd be responsible for all charges. After researching this model on the internet, I see that after about 2 years, multiple problems abound and made the decision to purchase another tv to replace the Samsung. I got a 55" Vizio (It's our 3rd Vizio tv- we've had them running without problem for 7 years).Read this article before you buy a Samsung TV:[...]

Reviews.Title: Ok for a while.
Reviews.Author: John Fain Jr.
Reviews.Content: Everything was great for two years.  Now there is a red line running from top to bottom of the screen just to the right of center.  Just appeared all of a sudden.  Pretty disappointed considering how much it cost.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy
Reviews.Author: Evariste "php dude"
Reviews.Content: I got this TV about 2 years ago. It worked great until one day the TV Screen started to flicker. There is no way you can stop this problem. We tried taking apart the TV and trying to fix it, but this was a problem you couldn't fix. So now, its in the trash. PLEASE DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: sean
Reviews.Content: tv has been solid since day 1.has survived countless hours on the the PS3 playing many COD titles...would happily have bought it again.  although nowadays LED is the way to go...love this tv still

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price
Reviews.Author: John Christensen "John C"
Reviews.Content: Only issue I have is the picture is a bit dark at times, don't know if this is a station or TV issue, but there dosen't seem to be a way to adjust briteness that I have found.

Reviews.Title: No Complaints
Reviews.Author: Super Shopper
Reviews.Content: At first we thought 46 inches was too large for our 11-foot viewing distance, but I'm glad we did not go smaller.  The Samsung quality is great and the swivel stand makes it easier to make connections on the side.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality - Do Not Buy Samsung
Reviews.Author: Greg Post
Reviews.Content: I would not buy a Samsung TV.  I purchased mine two years ago and the main PCB board needs to be replaced, a $385 repair.  I contacted Samsung customer service and their ECR group and neither helped me.  I have read other recent reviews on this set and it appears after two years, the sets start breaking down.  I owned my previous TV for 21 years with no problems.  At the very least, you need to purchase the extended warranty although I believe that only covers an additional 3 years.  I am going elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Flickering Issue
Reviews.Author: Amit Khandelwal
Reviews.Content: I bought this unit in April 2010. In September 2012, the screen starting flickering like a strobe light. Many people have had similar complaints. Samsung Support will not acknowledge that this is a known issue and say that the TV has to serviced by a technician. I followed the following instructions which have worked so far: [...]

Reviews.Title: flicker problem
Reviews.Author: M. H. Baker
Reviews.Content: this model develops a flickering problem which starts slowly and gets worse until its constantly strobing.  occured 26 months after date of purchase in my case.  evidence of a known problem is all over the internet.found an online instruction to fix it, which has worked temporarily to eliminate the flicker.  was a good deal for the picture at purchase, but still disappointed in the reliability.

Reviews.Title: Really Great TV
Reviews.Author: Kevin Rector
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about a year now and it is just great. It has a fabulous array of inputs, a very clear picture, easy to use interface, and great sound. I LOVE this TV. I don't know if you can still get one (as electronics upgrade and deprecate so fast) but if you can, I'd just on it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: snook
Reviews.Content: Liked it's big brother(55in) so much that I purchased this one for the basement. Excellent LCD TV with great picture quality.Very pleased with the Samsung LCD TV's

Reviews.Title: Flickering! OMG!!!!!
Reviews.Author: M. XU "tiger"
Reviews.Content: I wish there would be more reviews earlier talking about this problem. I purchase the TV on July 2010, almost right after 1 year warranty expire, the screen starts to have flickering problem. It flicker for a few minutes, and then back to normal. However, the flickering gets more and more often and last longer and longer. Now, it is almost impossible to watch. I am going to call samsung customer service tomorrow. I will update the score pending on their response. It is sad to see some many related review posted in the last few months. I hope the samsung would be a responsible company.

Reviews.Title: COMPLIMENTS, Nothing but compliments!
Reviews.Author: Mostasa
Reviews.Content: Just pull the trigger! If you're not happy, just return it!That's how I felt about it over a year ago and not one single complaint.Everyone that visits is amazed by the clarity.Happily payed AMAZON eight Benjamins and two Jacksons!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Great picture, nice sound, lots of connections, easy to use.  For the price I thought it was a great deal.  I have had it for a year without a single problem.

Reviews.Title: Screen Flickers
Reviews.Author: David Ayala
Reviews.Content: After a year and a half, the screen started flickering. After poking around on the internet, I found this was a common problem with few solutions. The TV warranty runs out after a year, and best buy and samsung aren't too helpful. $1000 down the drain.

Reviews.Title: Stroboscopic screen flickering
Reviews.Author: Gallo
Reviews.Content: I would avoid this television.  I purchased it in May 2010.  Within 18 months, the screen began to flicker like a strobe light.  The stroboscopic flickering makes the television unwatchable.  This is a common problem with Samsung LCD televisions.  Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV!! Crystal clear!!
Reviews.Author: Satisfied Customer??
Reviews.Content: This television is awesome. The only complaint that I have heard from visitors is that the picture looks too real. What a complaint to have! When I'm watching sports it feels like I am in the game. The sound is also awesome. I have absolutely no complaints about this television and I've owned it for almost 7 months.

Reviews.Title: Flickers!!!!
Reviews.Author: Sara
Reviews.Content: This TV was great until a little over a year (after the warranty expired of course). Then the TV keeps flickering. I wouldn't recommend this model.

Reviews.Title: Great deal at first...
Reviews.Author: M. Sargent
Reviews.Content: This TV was fantastic while it lasted. Had I reviewed it shortly after purchasing, I would have given it 5 stars.Unfortunately, it only lasted for just over 1 year (From August 2010 - October 2011). About one month ago, the screen started to constantly flicker. I adjusted some of the settings and let it "rest" for some time and it eventually started to work properly again. As of today, the flickering is back and it only seems to be getting worse. I am setting up an appointment to see if it would be worth it to have the TV repaired or not. Being the holiday season, it might just be better to go with a new TV.I would say that you should buy this with caution and take any extended warranty protection. Unless you are getting this TV for a few hundred dollars, I would not recommend buying this product.Edit: I will say that my experience with Samsung customer support has been great. They did a fantastic job setting me up with a repairman and they were even able to extend my warranty since I was still close to the original end date. Now I will just have to see how much of the repair they are able to cover. I still stick by my low rating for the actual product, but Samsung has been great so far working with me to correct the problem.

Reviews.Title: Broke after just one year
Reviews.Author: Serge Kavetsky "Mr. Fix-it"
Reviews.Content: Started to flicker then eventually went dark. Common problem among the Samsungs.  This same problem is described all over the internet. The repair tech that Samsung sent out wanted over $300 to repair it.  Save yourself the headache and buy another brand.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV Sucks
Reviews.Author: Julio Rodriguez "Julrod"
Reviews.Content: I have had the tv since July of 2010 - by October of 2011 it started failing. The screen flickers and is driving me crazy. After reading web blogs, apparantly others are having the same problems with Samsung TVs.....and Samsung does not want to fix the problem. DO NOT BUY SAMSUNG...you are better off with a SONY.

Reviews.Title: One year and two months later
Reviews.Author: Scott Hermon
Reviews.Content: A little over one year later and the screen now flickers constantly.  SAMSUNG denies any knowledge of the issue despite numerous posts and wont replace or repair on their dime.  I will admit the quality of the picture was great, but it is just terrible quality for the TV to need service this soon.  I will not being buying another SAMSUNG.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46C630 Flickerring 5 month off the warranty
Reviews.Author: Fang-fang Huang
Reviews.Content: Purchase this TV in last May. Got flickering problem few weeks ago. Chatted online with Samsung support and was told to adjust backlight to 7 and it will be OK after 3 weeks. And few weeks later, flickering came back again and become worse. Chatted with them again and problem can not solved. Redirected to Service Request and was called today from a tech person. Described the problem and the tech person gave no clue about what is the problem and cost. I need to drive 50 miles to the store and pay $40 to get diagnosis. Don't know what should do.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Deal!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: kb "klasala2"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV for our basement rec room based on the price - and was so impressed with the quality of a "Used - Like New" item that we ended up moving it to our main Family Room.  Awesome picture quality, item looks brand new, and works GREAT!

Reviews.Title: Great TV With Soap Opera Mode Off
Reviews.Author: PCAMZN101
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews of this tv before we bought and didn't quite know what everyone was talking about when they described the soap opera effect.  When you see it, you will know.The picture is almost 3D and you see the Hollywood tricks.  Green screen and special effects work is very apparent.Personally this destroys my ability to get lost in the scene because the tricks can be detected. I hate the default soap opera mode and I prefer other modes.My husband says it is like sitting on the stage with the actors. It is a whole new experience to rewatch his favorites.  I agree . . . it is a whole new experience but in my opinion NOT a good one. He gets a kick out of seeing things like painted actors in the background of John Wayne movies.So this tv is 5 stars when I turn off soap opera and 5 stars to my husband when it is on. That is our only problem.

Reviews.Title: A great purchase
Reviews.Author: Terry D. Janes "TheVikingsWorld.com"
Reviews.Content: We've had this TV for nearly a year now, and I love it!  I use it as a TV, and as a computer monitor, so it gets lots of use.  I bought the Square Trade extended warranty, which has a good reputation, so if the TV does have problems, I am not worried.  So far, it is much better than our older Samsung TV which did die eventually.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied but needs some calibration
Reviews.Author: 8cp1
Reviews.Content: Before settling on this model, I purchased (and returned) a 40" Philips and a 40" Samsung (40LN550C). I am very satisfied with this television.CONS:- Picture takes a LOT of calibration out of the box to get right. There are nearly 100 different controls that you can use to adjust the image. You may end up with a panel that is viewable out of the box, but if you want a great picture it will take a long time (or a professional) to get it right. However, a lot of people own this TV and you can find some very good recommended settings on various forums that will give you a great picture.- Sound is very good but not exceptional. You can play with the sound presets to get decent audio but you're better off with external speakers. That said, in my opinion it does not underperform comparable TVs as far as sound goes.- There is a bit of a lag when accessing the menu to change picture settings, input, etc. This is not uncommon in TVs but it might be annoying for some people out there.- The DLNA is slow and crashes frequently. I can use it to watch movies no problem, but when I'm scrolling through pictures or trying to find that song, it is very slow and randomly crashes. This may have to do with the software I'm using on my computer, but I've tried a few different ones with similar results. Also, last I checked Samsung does not make their DLNA software for Mac (although there are OSX alternatives out there).PROS:- Excellent picture, especially in HD.- Beautiful hardware. Obviously not as sleek as the LCD Samsungs but also not nearly as expensive.- Makes that wonderful little Samsung jingle when you switch it on and off (unless the volume down to zero).- Excellent viewing angle, at least in my experience.I definitely recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with purchase
Reviews.Author: kennyg
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV from Amazon in May, 2011.  I was looking for a 1080p TV that could fit into a limited wall-space; I selected this TV partially based on its slim bezel to maximize the screen space.Delivery was up to normal excellent Amazon standards.Setup was easy (standard wall-mount) and the inputs were easily accessible.  Turn-on time is limited to a few seconds and no silly title screen pops up prior to displaying input.  The menu system was logical (I've owned a few other Samsung TV's) although the amount of button pushing to advance to the final desired menu seems a bit redundant at times.The screen performance is very satisfactory. I was lucky and received an SQ panel.  Turned off the motion-flow except for PS3 input (where my Blu-rays are played) which I set to "clear" and am quite pleased with the results - excellent clarity and smooth transitions.  The TV is in a bright room and I don't have any complaints about light reflection (although my viewing is almost always limited to 90 degrees +/- 20 degrees).  The contrast level is good, although my brother-in-law (who has only owned plasma screens) thinks that it's noticeably less than his sets.  Haven't had any problems with uneven colors although I haven't put it through a color slide computer test -- I have watched a lot of sports and the green fields look even to me upon close inspection.I thought that the "volume" icon in the corner was strange at first, but now am quite pleased that it doesn't obstruct subtitles/sports scores/ticker tape news updates with its position.  I know that volume icons can be made semi-transparent, but I am a fan of the positioning in the left-hand corner where there is rarely anything significant displayed on screen.Sound is your typically "adequate but not great" standard.  Overall volume can be set quite loud, but conversational audio is oftentimes quite muted.  I have to place volume at "25" to really hear all conversations on a sit-com while I play video games at "15" with completely adequate sound effects.  My TV is stationed in a wall alcove, so maybe this is part of the problem.  Regardless, I use a receiver with 5 speakers so it's not much of a hindrance for me (although my wife does not like to turn on a separate receiver set to watch TV, so she just turns the TV volume up to 35 so that I get a heart attack the next time I return to play the PS3).I don't use the remote so can't comment too much about it other than it seems functional for the brief time I used it.Overall I'm very pleased with the TV; I think its display is rock-solid and its minimalist visual appeal is exactly what I wanted.  For this price range I personally think that one should get a great LCD screen instead of a average LED screen (not that I'm claiming to be an LED expert).

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!!
Reviews.Author: Ty Vernon
Reviews.Content: So after some extensive research, I decided to go with the TV you are currently reading about.  I can happily say that I am very pleased with my decision.  I watch a lot of movies and TV's, so this purchase was not something I took lightly.  As it was my first foray into the flat panel market, I wanted to make sure I got a good one.
